name: Susan B. Anthony
profession: Civil rights leader, Women's rights activist, Suffragist
bio: Susan B. Anthony (1820-1906) was an American civil rights leader, women's rights activist, and suffragist. She was born into a Quaker family in Massachusetts and was raised with a strong belief in equality for all people. Anthony began her activism by working with the American Anti-Slavery Society in the 1850s, and later became involved in the women's suffrage movement. She was a co-founder of the National Woman Suffrage Association in 1869, and worked tirelessly to secure voting rights for women. Anthony was also a prominent speaker, writer, and organizer, traveling across the United States and Europe to give speeches and gather support for women's suffrage. In 1872, Anthony was arrested for voting illegally in the presidential election, and her trial helped to bring attention to the cause of women's suffrage. Although Anthony did not live to see the passage of the 19th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution in 1920, which granted women the right to vote, her tireless advocacy and dedication to the cause paved the way for future generations of women to fight for their rights.
briefBio:
Susan B. Anthony (1820-1906) was an American social reformer and women's rights activist who played a pivotal role in the women's suffrage movement. Born in Massachusetts, she grew up in a Quaker family that advocated for social equality and abolitionism. In the 1850s, Anthony became involved in the temperance movement and later turned her attention to women's rights, specifically suffrage.

Anthony co-founded the National Woman Suffrage Association with Elizabeth Cady Stanton and served as its president from 1892 until 1900. She tirelessly worked to promote women's suffrage, giving speeches across the country and leading campaigns for women's right to vote. Despite facing criticism and opposition, Anthony persevered and became a symbol of the suffrage movement.

Anthony also worked to promote other social reforms, such as the abolition of slavery and the improvement of labor conditions for women. She believed that social change could only come through activism and direct action, and dedicated her life to fighting for the rights of marginalized groups.

Today, Anthony is remembered as one of the most influential figures in the women's suffrage movement and a trailblazer for gender equality. Her legacy continues to inspire activists and advocates for social justice around the world.

name: Bill Gates
bio: Bill Gates is an American entrepreneur, software developer, and philanthropist. He co-founded Microsoft Corporation, the world's largest personal-computer software company, with Paul Allen. Gates is also known for his charitable work through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.
briefBio:
Bill Gates is an American entrepreneur, software developer, and philanthropist. He was born on October 28, 1955, in Seattle, Washington. Gates is best known as the co-founder of Microsoft Corporation, the world's largest personal-computer software company.

Gates started programming computers at a young age and went on to study at Harvard University. However, he dropped out in his second year to start Microsoft with his childhood friend Paul Allen. Together, they developed software for personal computers, including the iconic Windows operating system, which revolutionized the computer industry.

Under Gates' leadership, Microsoft became one of the most successful companies in history. Gates remained at the helm of Microsoft until 2000, and during his tenure, he was widely regarded as one of the most powerful and influential figures in the technology industry.

In recent years, Gates has focused on philanthropy through the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, which he co-founded with his wife. The foundation works to improve global health and reduce poverty, with a particular emphasis on supporting education and healthcare initiatives in developing countries.

Gates has been widely recognized for his contributions to the technology industry and his philanthropic work. He has received numerous awards and honors, including the Presidential Medal of Freedom, and has been named one of the most powerful people in the world by Forbes magazine.

name: Tom Holland
bio: Tom Holland is an English actor best known for his role as Spider-Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. He began his career as a child actor in the West End production of Billy Elliot the Musical. He then went on to appear in several films and television shows before landing the role of Spider-Man in Captain America: Civil War. He has since reprised the role in Spider-Man: Homecoming, Spider-Man: Far From Home, and Avengers: Infinity War. Holland has won several awards for his acting, including a BAFTA Rising Star Award in 2017.
briefBio:
Tom Holland is an English actor best known for his role as Peter Parker/Spider-Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. He was born on June 1, 1996, in London, England, and grew up in Kingston upon Thames. Holland developed a love for acting at a young age and attended the BRIT School for Performing Arts and Technology in London.

Holland's big break came in 2012 when he was cast as Billy Elliot in the West End production of Billy Elliot the Musical. He later made his film debut in the disaster film The Impossible (2012) alongside Naomi Watts and Ewan McGregor. Holland's breakthrough role came in 2016 when he was cast as Spider-Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. He has since appeared in several films as the character, including Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Spider-Man: Far From Home (2019), and Avengers: Infinity War (2018) and Avengers: Endgame (2019).

In addition to his work in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Holland has also appeared in several other films, including The Lost City of Z (2016), The Current War (2017), and Cherry (2021). He has received critical acclaim for his performances in these films, demonstrating his range as an actor.

Off-screen, Holland is known for his philanthropic work, particularly his involvement with The Brothers Trust, a charity he co-founded with his brothers that supports charitable causes around the world. Holland is also an advocate for environmental causes and has spoken publicly about the need for action to address climate change.

name: Rani Lakshmibai
bio: Rani Lakshmibai was the queen of the princely state of Jhansi in north-central India. She was a skilled warrior and led her army against the British in the Indian Rebellion of 1857. She died at the young age of 29 in battle, but her bravery and leadership continue to inspire generations.
briefBio:
Rani Lakshmibai, also known as the Rani of Jhansi, was a brave and fearless Indian queen who played a significant role in India's struggle for independence. She was born on November 19, 1828, in Varanasi, India, and was named Manikarnika Tambe.

Lakshmibai was married to the Maharaja of Jhansi, Raja Gangadhar Rao, at the age of 14. However, her husband died without leaving an heir, and the British East India Company tried to annex Jhansi. Lakshmibai, who was known for her military prowess and bravery, refused to surrender her kingdom to the British.

In 1857, the Indian Rebellion broke out, and Rani Lakshmibai led her army into battle against the British. She fought fiercely, riding on horseback with her young son tied to her back. Despite being outnumbered, the Rani of Jhansi managed to hold off the British army for several months. She was finally killed in battle on June 18, 1858, at the age of 29.

Rani Lakshmibai remains an inspiration to many Indians, especially women, for her courage and bravery in the face of oppression. Her legacy is commemorated through numerous statues, museums, and memorials across India.

name: Mangal Pandey
profession: Sepoy (soldier) in the British East India Company
bio: Mangal Pandey was a soldier in the British East India Company who played a key role in the Indian Rebellion of 1857. He is remembered for his courage and sacrifice in fighting against the British.
briefBio:
Mangal Pandey was an Indian soldier who played a pivotal role in India's struggle for independence against British colonial rule. He was born on July 19, 1827, in a small village in Uttar Pradesh, India. He joined the British Indian Army in 1849 and was part of the 34th Bengal Native Infantry regiment.

In 1857, Mangal Pandey became a key figure in the Indian Rebellion against the British East India Company. On March 29, 1857, he attacked his British officers and started a revolt that led to the outbreak of the Indian Rebellion of 1857. He was eventually captured and executed on April 8, 1857, but his actions inspired many other Indian soldiers to join the rebellion.

Mangal Pandey's rebellion is considered to be the first war of Indian independence. His bravery and sacrifice inspired many Indians to fight for their freedom from British colonial rule. He is remembered as a symbol of resistance and courage in India's struggle for independence. In his memory, the Indian government has issued postage stamps and erected a statue in his honor.

name: Ryan Gosling
bio: Ryan Gosling is a Canadian actor and producer known for his roles in films like The Notebook, Drive, and La La Land. He started his career in the 1990s in Canadian TV shows and later moved to Hollywood. He is also the founder of the production company, Maximum Effort Productions. Gosling is known for his witty sense of humor and his dedication to his craft. He has won several awards throughout his career, including a Golden Globe nomination for his performance in the film La La Land.
briefBio:
Ryan Gosling is a Canadian actor and musician who gained international recognition for his roles in various films. He was born on November 12, 1980, in London, Ontario. Gosling began his career in show business as a child actor, appearing in various television shows, including "The Mickey Mouse Club."

Gosling's breakout role came in 2004, when he played the lead in the romantic drama "The Notebook," which quickly became a classic. He went on to star in other successful films, including "Crazy, Stupid, Love," "Drive," and "La La Land," which earned him critical acclaim and award nominations.

In addition to acting, Gosling is also a musician. He is a member of the band Dead Man's Bones, which he formed in 2007 with his friend Zach Shields. The band has released one album and has toured extensively in the United States.

Gosling has been recognized for his talents with numerous awards, including a Golden Globe for his performance in "La La Land." He is also known for his humanitarian efforts, including his work with PETA and his support for the Enough Project, which aims to end genocide and crimes against humanity.

name: Rob Walton
bio: Robert Edward "Rob" Walton is an American businessman and philanthropist. He is the second son of Walmart founder Sam Walton and the brother of Walmart CEO Doug McMillon. He is the co-founder of the Walton Family Foundation, which has donated more than $1.5 billion to charitable causes.
briefBio:
Rob Walton is an American businessman and the eldest son of Walmart founder Sam Walton. He was born on October 28, 1944, in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

Walton served as the chairman of Walmart's board of directors from 1992 to 2015, and also served as the company's CEO from 1992 to 2000. During his tenure, Walmart grew into the world's largest retailer, with over 11,000 stores worldwide.

With a net worth of over $60 billion, Walton is one of the richest people in the world. He inherited a portion of his father's wealth, which he has since expanded through his involvement in various business ventures.

Walton is known for his philanthropic work and has donated millions of dollars to support education and other causes. He has also been involved in various environmental initiatives, and is a member of the board of directors of Conservation International, a non-profit organization dedicated to protecting nature and biodiversity around the world.

In addition to his business and philanthropic activities, Walton is also an avid art collector and has a personal collection that includes works by some of the world's most renowned artists. He has also been involved in various cultural and educational initiatives, and has supported organizations that promote the arts and humanities.

name: Brad Pitt
bio: Brad Pitt is an American actor and producer. He has won numerous awards for his acting, including an Academy Award, a Golden Globe Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Award. Pitt is known for his roles in popular films like Fight Club, Ocean's Eleven, and Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.
briefBio:
Brad Pitt is an American actor and producer who has appeared in a wide range of films across different genres. He was born on December 18, 1963, in Shawnee, Oklahoma, and raised in Springfield, Missouri. He attended the University of Missouri where he studied journalism, but dropped out two weeks before completing his degree to pursue a career in acting.

Pitt's breakthrough role came in 1991 with the film "Thelma & Louise", and since then he has starred in numerous critically acclaimed movies such as "Fight Club", "Ocean's Eleven", and "Inglourious Basterds". He has received numerous awards and nominations for his work, including an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his performance in "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" (2019).

Pitt is also known for his philanthropic work, particularly his support for environmental causes and efforts to rebuild New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina. He has been involved with various charities, including the Make It Right Foundation and the Jolie-Pitt Foundation, which he co-founded with his ex-wife Angelina Jolie.

In addition to his acting career, Pitt has also produced numerous films, including "The Departed" and "12 Years a Slave", both of which won Academy Awards for Best Picture. He has been named one of the world's most attractive men and has been the face of several high-profile advertising campaigns.

name: Emma Watson
bio: Emma Watson is a British actress and activist. She rose to fame as Hermione Granger in the Harry Potter film series and has since appeared in a number of other films. Watson is also an advocate for gender equality and has been appointed as a UN Women Goodwill Ambassador.
briefBio:
Emma Watson is an English actress, activist, and model. She was born on April 15, 1990, in Paris, France, but grew up in England. She rose to fame as a child actress, playing the role of Hermione Granger in the Harry Potter film series.

After the Harry Potter films ended, Watson continued to act in a variety of roles, including in the films The Perks of Being a Wallflower and Little Women. She has also become known for her fashion sense, and has been a model for several fashion brands.

In addition to her acting and modeling career, Watson is also an outspoken advocate for gender equality and women's rights. She has served as a UN Women Goodwill Ambassador and launched the HeForShe campaign, which encourages men to support gender equality.

Watson's activism has earned her numerous awards and honors, including the British Style Award and the MTV Trailblazer Award. She has also been named one of the most influential people in the world by Time magazine.

Watson is widely regarded as a positive role model for young women, and her advocacy work has helped to raise awareness of important social issues. She continues to use her platform to promote gender equality and encourage young people to get involved in activism.

name: P.V. Sindhu
bio: P.V. Sindhu is an Indian badminton player who has won several medals at international events including the Olympics, World Championships, and Asian Games. She became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic silver medal in 2016 and then went on to win a bronze medal at the 2021 Olympics. Sindhu is also a recipient of the Padma Shri, one of India's highest civilian awards.
briefBio:
Pusarla Venkata Sindhu, commonly known as P.V. Sindhu, is an Indian badminton player who has made significant contributions to the sport. Born on July 5, 1995, in Hyderabad, India, Sindhu began playing badminton at the age of eight and quickly made a name for herself on the national and international circuits.

Sindhu's first major achievement came in 2013 when she won the bronze medal at the World Championships, becoming the first Indian woman to do so. She continued to shine in the years that followed, winning silver at the 2016 Rio Olympics and gold at the 2019 World Championships. In addition to these achievements, Sindhu has won several other titles, including the BWF World Tour Finals, the Indian Open, and the Korea Open.

Sindhu is known for her aggressive style of play, powerful smashes, and excellent footwork. Her dedication, hard work, and determination have made her one of the most successful badminton players in the world. Off the court, she is known for her humility, grace, and sportsmanship.

Sindhu has received numerous awards and honors for her contributions to the sport, including the Padma Shri, India's fourth-highest civilian award, and the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna, India's highest sporting honor. She is also a recipient of the Arjuna Award and the Padma Bhushan. Sindhu continues to inspire young athletes across India and around the world with her impressive skills, hard work, and dedication to the sport of badminton.

name: Leonardo DiCaprio
bio: Leonardo DiCaprio is an American actor and producer. He has won numerous awards for his acting, including an Academy Award, a BAFTA Award, and a Golden Globe Award. DiCaprio is known for his roles in popular films like Titanic, Inception, The Wolf of Wall Street, and many others.
briefBio:
Leonardo DiCaprio is an American actor, producer, and environmental activist. He was born on November 11, 1974 in Los Angeles, California. He began his acting career in the late 1980s and gained recognition in the 1990s with his roles in movies such as "What's Eating Gilbert Grape" and "Romeo + Juliet". He has since gone on to star in many critically acclaimed and commercially successful movies.

DiCaprio's breakthrough role was in the 1997 movie "Titanic", which became one of the highest-grossing movies of all time. He has also received critical acclaim for his performances in movies such as "The Aviator", "The Departed", "Inception", "The Revenant", and many others. He has been nominated for numerous awards, including five Academy Awards, and has won one for Best Actor for his role in "The Revenant".

In addition to his acting career, DiCaprio is also known for his environmental activism. He founded the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation in 1998 to support environmental causes, and has been involved in many initiatives to raise awareness about climate change and protect the environment.

DiCaprio is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation and has a net worth of over $260 million. He continues to act in movies and use his platform to raise awareness about environmental issues.

name: Denzel Washington
bio: Denzel Washington is an American actor, director, and producer. He has won two Academy Awards, three Golden Globe Awards, and a Tony Award, among other accolades. Washington is known for his powerful performances in films like Training Day, Malcolm X, The Hurricane, and many others.
briefBio:
Denzel Washington is an American actor, director, and producer. He was born on December 28, 1954, in Mount Vernon, New York, USA. Washington attended Fordham University, where he graduated with a B.A. in Drama and Journalism in 1977. He began his acting career in theatre, performing in several Off-Broadway productions, and then went on to star in several television shows and films.

Washington's breakthrough role came in the 1982 NBC medical drama St. Elsewhere, in which he played a young resident. He later starred in popular films such as Malcolm X, The Hurricane, Training Day, and The Book of Eli. Washington has won numerous awards for his work, including two Academy Awards, three Golden Globe Awards, and a Tony Award. In addition to his acting work, Washington has also directed and produced several films, including Antwone Fisher and The Great Debaters.

Washington is known for his versatility and range as an actor, and his ability to portray complex characters with depth and nuance. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation and has been praised for his contributions to the film industry both in front of and behind the camera.

name: Rohit Sharma
bio: Rohit Sharma is an Indian cricketer and former captain of the Indian national team. He is one of the best openers in the world and has several records to his name, including the highest individual score in ODIs (264 runs). Sharma has received several awards for his performances, including the Arjuna Award in 2015 and the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna in 2020.
briefBio:
Rohit Sharma is an Indian cricketer who is considered to be one of the best opening batsmen in the world. He was born on April 30, 1987, in Nagpur, Maharashtra, India. Rohit started playing cricket at a young age and showed his talent as a middle-order batsman. He made his debut for the Indian cricket team in 2007 and has since then become one of the most reliable players in the team.

Rohit is known for his elegant batting style and his ability to score big runs. He is the only cricketer in the world to have scored three double centuries in One Day Internationals (ODIs). He also holds the record for the highest individual score in an ODI match, with a score of 264 runs.

Apart from his batting, Rohit is also a skilled fielder and a part-time off-spinner. He has been a key player in India's success in limited-overs cricket, including the 2013 ICC Champions Trophy and the 2015 ICC Cricket World Cup.

Off the field, Rohit is known for his calm and composed demeanor. He is a family man and is married to Ritika Sajdeh, with whom he has a daughter named Samaira. Rohit has also been actively involved in various charitable activities, including helping children with heart diseases and promoting environmental conservation.

name: Bhagat Singh
bio: Bhagat Singh was an Indian socialist revolutionary whose two acts of dramatic violence against the British in India and execution at age 23 made him a folk hero of the Indian independence movement. Singh was influential in the Indian socialist movement, founding the Naujawan Bharat Sabha ("Youth Society of India") in March 1926.
briefBio:
Bhagat Singh was an Indian socialist revolutionary who played a key role in the Indian independence movement. He was born in Banga village in present-day Pakistan in 1907. Bhagat Singh was deeply influenced by the Jallianwala Bagh massacre of 1919 and became involved in revolutionary politics at a young age.

Bhagat Singh was a prominent member of the Hindustan Socialist Republican Association (HSRA) and played a crucial role in the organization's activities. He was involved in several acts of revolutionary violence, including the bombing of the Central Legislative Assembly in Delhi in 1929, for which he and his comrades were arrested and sentenced to death.

During his imprisonment, Bhagat Singh became an icon of the Indian independence movement, and his ideas on socialism, secularism, and non-violence continue to inspire Indians today. He used his time in jail to write extensively on his political beliefs, and his writings, such as "Why I Am An Atheist," remain popular today.

Bhagat Singh was hanged on March 23, 1931, at the age of 23, but his legacy lives on as a symbol of Indian nationalism and revolutionary struggle against colonialism.

name: Angelina Jolie
bio: Angelina Jolie is a talented actress and filmmaker who is known for her humanitarian work around the world. She has won an Academy Award, three Golden Globe Awards, and two Screen Actors Guild Awards. Jolie has been named one of the world's most powerful women by Forbes magazine on numerous occasions. Some of her most famous films include Girl, Interrupted, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, and Maleficent.
briefBio:
Angelina Jolie is an American actress, filmmaker, and humanitarian born on June 4, 1975, in Los Angeles, California. She comes from a family of actors and her father, Jon Voight, is also an Academy Award-winning actor. She started her acting career in 1982 with a small role in the movie “Lookin' to Get Out” and later gained fame for her roles in “Girl, Interrupted”, “Mr. & Mrs. Smith”, and the “Tomb Raider” series. She has won several awards including an Academy Award, three Golden Globe Awards, and two Screen Actors Guild Awards.

In addition to her acting career, Angelina Jolie has been actively involved in humanitarian efforts around the world. She has served as a Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and has visited several war-torn countries to raise awareness about the plight of refugees. She has also founded the Maddox Jolie-Pitt Foundation to support conservation efforts and aid in humanitarian crises.

Jolie is also known for her personal life, having been married to fellow actor Brad Pitt and having six children, three of whom were adopted internationally. She is a vocal advocate for adoption and has spoken publicly about her own experiences adopting children from different parts of the world.

Despite her success, Angelina Jolie has faced some controversy over the years, including her publicized divorce from Brad Pitt and her decision to undergo a preventive double mastectomy after testing positive for the BRCA1 gene, which greatly increases the risk of breast cancer.

name: Katharine Hepburn
bio: Katharine Hepburn was an American actress known for her fierce independence and spirited personality. She won four Academy Awards and was nominated for a total of twelve, making her the most nominated actor in history. Hepburn's career spanned over six decades and she appeared in more than 50 films, including classics like 'The Philadelphia Story,' 'Guess Who's Coming to Dinner,' and 'On Golden Pond.'
briefBio:
Katharine Hepburn was an American actress whose career spanned over six decades. She was born on May 12, 1907, in Hartford, Connecticut. Hepburn was known for her unique style and independent spirit, both on and off-screen. She began her career in the early 1930s, appearing in a number of successful films, including "Little Women" (1933), "Bringing Up Baby" (1938), and "The Philadelphia Story" (1940).

Throughout her career, Hepburn received numerous awards and accolades, including four Academy Awards for Best Actress, the most for any actor or actress in history. She was known for her strong-willed and outspoken personality, and was a feminist icon during a time when women were not often portrayed as independent or intelligent in Hollywood films.

Hepburn continued to act well into her later years, appearing in films such as "On Golden Pond" (1981) and "Love Affair" (1994). She was also involved in several philanthropic causes, including the fight against AIDS.

Hepburn passed away on June 29, 2003, at the age of 96. She remains one of the most iconic actresses in American film history, and her legacy continues to inspire generations of actors and actresses.

name: Sergey Brin
bio: Sergey Mikhaylovich Brin is a Russian-born American computer scientist, Internet entrepreneur, philanthropist, and co-founder of Google. He is the President of Alphabet Inc., Google's parent company. Brin is considered one of the pioneers of the field of web search and was ranked as the 9th most influential person in the world by Time magazine in 2013.
briefBio:
Sergey Brin is an American computer scientist and entrepreneur. He was born on August 21, 1973, in Moscow, Russia.

Brin is best known as the co-founder of Google, one of the world's largest and most influential technology companies. Along with his partner Larry Page, he helped to develop Google's search algorithm and build the company into a dominant force in online search and advertising.

In addition to his work with Google, Brin has been involved in a number of other technology ventures, including developing the X lab at Google, which focuses on moonshot projects such as self-driving cars and Google Glass.

Brin is known for his innovative approach to technology and his interest in exploring new and cutting-edge technologies. He has been recognized for his contributions to the industry with a number of awards and honors, including being named one of Time magazine's "100 most influential people in the world."

Like his partner Page, Brin has also faced criticism related to Google's handling of user data and its operations in China.

With his pioneering work in technology and his commitment to pushing the boundaries of what's possible, Sergey Brin remains a significant figure in the world of tech and innovation.

name: Thomas Jefferson
bio: Thomas Jefferson was the 3rd President of the United States, serving from 1801 to 1809. He is best known for his role as a Founding Father and author of the Declaration of Independence. Jefferson also served as a diplomat, writer, and philosopher, and he was a strong advocate for democracy, republicanism, and individual rights. During his presidency, Jefferson oversaw the Louisiana Purchase, which doubled the size of the United States, and he was instrumental in the establishment of the University of Virginia.
briefBio:
Thomas Jefferson (1743-1826) was an American statesman, diplomat, and the third president of the United States. He is best known for his role in drafting the Declaration of Independence, which declared the colonies' independence from Great Britain. Jefferson was born in Virginia, where he also served as the state's governor and later represented it in the US Congress.

Jefferson was a proponent of democracy, individual liberty, and religious freedom. As president, he made the Louisiana Purchase, which doubled the size of the United States. He also commissioned the Lewis and Clark expedition to explore the newly acquired territory. Jefferson was an advocate of education, founding the University of Virginia, which emphasized liberal arts education.

Jefferson's presidency was not without controversy. He was criticized for his handling of the Barbary Wars, where he refused to pay tribute to North African pirates, leading to a conflict. He was also criticized for his policy towards Native Americans, which included forced relocation and assimilation.

Jefferson's legacy as a founding father of the United States is significant. He was a polymath, a man of many talents, interests, and achievements. He is remembered as a champion of democracy and individual liberty, and his ideas have influenced American politics to this day.

name: Jeff Bezos
bio: Jeff Bezos is an American entrepreneur and investor who is the founder and CEO of Amazon, the world's largest online retailer. He is currently the richest person in the world, with an estimated net worth of $185.1 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Jeff Bezos is an American entrepreneur and businessman who is best known as the founder and former CEO of Amazon, one of the world's largest and most successful online retailers. He was born on January 12, 1964, in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

Bezos founded Amazon in 1994, initially as an online bookstore, but the company quickly expanded into other areas such as electronics, clothing, and groceries. Under Bezos' leadership, Amazon became one of the most valuable companies in the world, with a market capitalization of over $1 trillion as of 2021.

In addition to his work at Amazon, Bezos has also been involved in a number of other ventures, including the aerospace company Blue Origin and the newspaper The Washington Post. He is also known for his philanthropy, having donated billions of dollars to various causes, including climate change research and education.

Bezos' career has not been without controversy, however, as Amazon has faced criticism over its labor practices and its impact on small businesses. Bezos himself has also faced personal scrutiny, including his high-profile divorce in 2019 and allegations of unethical behavior by The National Enquirer.

Despite these challenges, Bezos remains one of the most influential and successful businessmen of his generation, with a legacy that is sure to endure for years to come.

name: Marie Curie
bio: Marie Curie was a Polish-born physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, the first person to win two Nobel Prizes in different fields, and the first female professor at the University of Paris.
briefBio:
Marie Curie was a Polish-born French physicist and chemist who made pioneering contributions to the field of radioactivity. She was born on November 7, 1867, in Warsaw, Poland.

Curie is known for her groundbreaking research on radioactive elements, including her discovery of radium and polonium. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, and she went on to win a second Nobel Prize in a different field (chemistry) several years later. Her work laid the foundation for the development of nuclear physics and had a profound impact on the field of medicine.

In addition to her scientific achievements, Curie was known for her dedication and perseverance in the face of obstacles. She faced discrimination as a woman in a male-dominated field and worked tirelessly to advance her research in spite of financial and logistical challenges.

Curie's legacy continues to inspire and motivate people around the world, particularly women in STEM fields. Her life and work serve as a testament to the power of determination and the importance of pursuing one's passions and interests, regardless of the obstacles that may stand in the way.

name: Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar
origin: Mhow, Central Provinces (present-day Madhya Pradesh), India
profession: Jurist, economist, politician, and social reformer
bio: Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar was a key figure in the Indian independence movement and is best known for his role in drafting the Indian Constitution. He was also a champion of the rights of Dalits and other oppressed groups in India.
briefBio:
Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar, popularly known as Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, was a social reformer, politician, jurist, and economist who played a key role in shaping the modern Indian Constitution. Born on April 14, 1891, in Mhow, Madhya Pradesh, Ambedkar was born into a Dalit family and had to face discrimination and social exclusion throughout his life.

Despite facing many obstacles, Ambedkar was determined to succeed in life and went on to become one of the most prominent figures of modern India. He earned several degrees and went on to become the first Dalit to get a degree from the University of Bombay. He later went on to study at Columbia University in the United States, where he earned a degree in Economics.

Ambedkar is best known for his role in drafting the Indian Constitution and is often referred to as the "Father of the Indian Constitution." He was also a strong advocate of social justice and equality and worked tirelessly to uplift the Dalit community.

Ambedkar's contributions to Indian society have been widely recognized, and he is considered a national hero. His birthday, April 14th, is celebrated as Ambedkar Jayanti across India. His life and legacy continue to inspire millions of people in India and around the world.

name: Tom Hanks
bio: Tom Hanks is an American actor and filmmaker. He is known for his roles in popular films like Forrest Gump, The Green Mile, Cast Away, and many others. He has won numerous awards for his acting, including two Academy Awards, seven Primetime Emmy Awards, and four Golden Globe Awards.
briefBio:
Tom Hanks is an American actor and filmmaker, born on July 9, 1956 in Concord, California. He began his acting career in the late 1970s, but it was his portrayal of the lead character in the 1988 film "Big" that launched him to stardom. Since then, he has become one of the most successful and respected actors in Hollywood, known for his versatility and ability to play a wide range of characters.

Hanks has won numerous awards throughout his career, including two Academy Awards for Best Actor, one for his role in the 1993 film "Philadelphia" and another for the 1994 film "Forrest Gump." He has also received critical acclaim for his roles in films such as "Saving Private Ryan," "Cast Away," and "Captain Phillips."

In addition to his acting work, Hanks has also dabbled in writing and directing. He wrote, directed, and starred in the 1996 film "That Thing You Do!" and has since directed several other films, including "Larry Crowne" and "Greyhound."

Outside of his film career, Hanks is known for his philanthropic work, particularly in the areas of education and the environment. He is also a noted collector of vintage typewriters and has published a book of short stories called "Uncommon Type," which includes a typewriter in each story.

name: Priyanka Chopra Jonas
bio: Priyanka Chopra Jonas is an Indian actress and producer who has worked in Hindi films, as well as in American television and films. She is a former Miss World and has won numerous awards for her performances, including a National Film Award and five Filmfare Awards. Chopra Jonas is also a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador and is known for her philanthropic work.
briefBio:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas is an Indian actress, singer, and film producer who was born on July 18, 1982, in Jamshedpur, India. She has established herself as one of the most popular and successful actresses in Indian cinema and has also gained international fame for her work in Hollywood films.

Chopra began her career as a model and won the Miss World pageant in 2000. She made her acting debut in 2002 with the Tamil film "Thamizhan" and later starred in several Bollywood films, including "The Hero", "Andaaz", and "Mujhse Shaadi Karogi". She received critical acclaim for her performances in films like "Fashion", "7 Khoon Maaf", and "Barfi!".

In 2015, Chopra made her debut in American television with the series "Quantico" and gained widespread recognition for her performance as Alex Parrish. She has also appeared in several Hollywood films, including "Baywatch", "Isn't It Romantic", and "The White Tiger".

Apart from her acting career, Chopra is also known for her philanthropic work and has been a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador since 2016. She has also founded The Priyanka Chopra Foundation for Health and Education to support underprivileged children in India.

Chopra has won several awards, including a National Film Award and five Filmfare Awards, and has been named one of the most influential people in the world by Time magazine.

name: Meryl Streep
bio: Meryl Streep is widely regarded as one of the greatest actresses of all time. She has won three Academy Awards, eight Golden Globe Awards, and a Primetime Emmy Award. Streep made her screen debut in 1977 and has since appeared in numerous films, earning critical acclaim for her performances in movies like 'Kramer vs. Kramer,' 'Sophie's Choice,' 'The Devil Wears Prada,' and 'Doubt.'
briefBio:
Meryl Streep is an American actress known for her versatility and ability to embody a wide range of characters. She was born on June 22, 1949, in Summit, New Jersey, and grew up in nearby Bernardsville. She attended Vassar College and Yale School of Drama, where she honed her craft as an actress.

Streep made her film debut in 1977 in the movie "Julia," but it was her role in "The Deer Hunter" (1978) that brought her widespread recognition. Since then, she has been nominated for the Academy Award a record 21 times and has won three times, for her performances in "Kramer vs. Kramer" (1979), "Sophie's Choice" (1982), and "The Iron Lady" (2011).

Streep has also received numerous other accolades for her work, including eight Golden Globe Awards and two Screen Actors Guild Awards. In addition to her film work, she has also appeared in numerous stage productions and has won three Tony Awards.

Streep is known for her commitment to social and political causes, including women's rights and environmentalism. She has used her platform as an actress to speak out on these issues and to support organizations such as the National Women's History Museum and the Natural Resources Defense Council.

Despite her success and fame, Streep has remained humble and focused on her craft. She is widely regarded as one of the greatest actresses of all time and has inspired countless aspiring actors and actresses to pursue their dreams.

name: Oprah Winfrey
profession: Media Executive, Talk Show Host, Actress, Producer, Philanthropist
bio: Oprah Winfrey is an American media executive, talk show host, actress, producer, and philanthropist. She is best known for her talk show, The Oprah Winfrey Show, which was the highest-rated television program of its kind in history. She has also been involved in many charitable causes and has been recognized for her philanthropic work.
briefBio:
Oprah Winfrey is an American media executive, talk show host, actress, and philanthropist. She was born on January 29, 1954, in Kosciusko, Mississippi, and is best known for hosting The Oprah Winfrey Show, one of the highest-rated talk shows in television history.

Beyond her talk show, Winfrey has had a successful career in acting, producing, and as a media executive. She founded Harpo Productions, which produced The Oprah Winfrey Show, as well as several other successful television shows and films.

In addition to her media work, Winfrey is also a philanthropist and has donated millions of dollars to various causes, including education, healthcare, and disaster relief. She founded the Oprah Winfrey Leadership Academy for Girls, a school in South Africa that provides education and support for girls from disadvantaged backgrounds.

Winfrey has been recognized for her contributions to media and philanthropy with numerous awards and honors, including the Presidential Medal of Freedom and the Cecil B. DeMille Award. She is widely regarded as one of the most influential and powerful women in the world.

Winfrey's impact on popular culture and her advocacy for important social issues have earned her a place as a role model and inspiration to millions of people around the world. She continues to use her platform to promote important causes and inspire positive change.

name: Bal Gangadhar Tilak
profession: Indian nationalist, teacher, social reformer, lawyer
bio: Bal Gangadhar Tilak was a prominent leader of the Indian independence movement. He advocated for Indian self-rule and played a key role in organizing the movement against the British.
briefBio:
Bal Gangadhar Tilak, also known as Lokmanya Tilak, was an Indian nationalist, social reformer, and freedom fighter who played a significant role in India's struggle for independence from British rule. He was born on July 23, 1856, in Ratnagiri, Maharashtra, and passed away on August 1, 1920.

Tilak was a prominent member of the Indian National Congress and was considered one of the most radical leaders of the time. He was a strong advocate of Swaraj or self-rule and believed that it was necessary for India to gain independence from British rule.

Tilak was known for his fiery speeches and writings, and he used his platform to encourage Indians to fight for their rights and resist British oppression. He also played a significant role in the Indian independence movement's development of a militant nationalist philosophy, advocating the use of boycotts, strikes, and civil disobedience as means of protest.

Tilak was arrested several times by the British authorities for his political activities and spent several years in prison. He is also known for popularizing the slogan "Swaraj is my birthright, and I shall have it," which became a rallying cry for the Indian independence movement.

Today, Tilak is remembered as a visionary leader who played a vital role in India's freedom struggle and worked tirelessly to improve the lives of his fellow countrymen. His contributions to the Indian independence movement continue to inspire generations of Indians.

name: George Clooney
bio: George Clooney is an American actor, producer, and director. He has won three Golden Globe Awards and two Academy Awards, among other accolades. Clooney is known for his roles in popular films like O Brother, Where Art Thou?, The Descendants, and many others.
briefBio:
George Clooney is an American actor, director, producer, and screenwriter who has been a prominent figure in Hollywood for several decades. He was born on May 6, 1961, in Lexington, Kentucky, and grew up in a family involved in broadcasting and journalism. He initially pursued a career in journalism but eventually transitioned to acting and made his breakthrough on television in the medical drama "ER" in the mid-1990s.

Clooney has since appeared in numerous films, including "Ocean's Eleven," "Syriana," and "Up in the Air," and has won several awards for his performances, including an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role in "Syriana." He is also known for his humanitarian work, particularly in the areas of disaster relief and human rights advocacy, and was named a United Nations Messenger of Peace in 2008.

In addition to his acting and humanitarian work, Clooney has also directed and produced several films, including "Good Night, and Good Luck" and "The Ides of March." He has been recognized for his contributions to the film industry and philanthropic efforts with numerous awards and honors, including the AFI Life Achievement Award and the Bob Hope Humanitarian Award.

name: A.R. Rahman
bio: A.R. Rahman is an Indian music composer, singer, and music producer. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential musicians in the history of Indian music. Rahman has won numerous awards for his music, including two Academy Awards, two Grammy Awards, and a Golden Globe. He has also been involved in various philanthropic and social causes, including education, health, and poverty alleviation.
briefBio:
A.R. Rahman, also known as Allah-Rakha Rahman, is an Indian music composer, singer, and producer. He was born on January 6, 1967, in Chennai, India. Rahman's father was also a music composer, and he passed on his passion for music to his son. Rahman started playing the piano at the age of four and later learned several other musical instruments.

Rahman began his music career in the early 1990s composing jingles for ads and eventually moving on to film scores. He has won numerous awards for his work, including six National Film Awards, two Academy Awards, two Grammy Awards, a BAFTA Award, and a Golden Globe. He has also been awarded the Padma Bhushan and Padma Shri by the Indian government for his contributions to the field of music.

Rahman's music is known for its fusion of Indian classical music with electronic music, world music, and traditional orchestral arrangements. He has composed music for over 150 films in various languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, and English. Rahman's work on the film Slumdog Millionaire brought him international recognition and critical acclaim. His music for the film won him two Academy Awards, a Golden Globe, and a BAFTA.

Apart from his work in films, Rahman has also released several albums of his own music and collaborated with international artists such as Michael Jackson, Andrew Lloyd Webber, and Hans Zimmer. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest music composers in the world and a cultural icon in India.

name: Barack Obama
bio: Barack Obama served as the 44th President of the United States from 2009 to 2017. Born in Honolulu, Hawaii, Obama studied at Columbia University and Harvard Law School before working as a civil rights attorney in Chicago. In 1996, he was elected to the Illinois State Senate, and four years later, he was elected to the U.S. Senate representing Illinois. In 2008, he won the Democratic nomination for President, and in November of that year, he was elected President of the United States. During his presidency, Obama implemented the Affordable Care Act, passed the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, and oversaw the successful military operation that resulted in the death of Osama bin Laden.
briefBio:
Barack Obama is an American politician and attorney who served as the 44th President of the United States from 2009 to 2017. Born in Honolulu, Hawaii, Obama graduated from Columbia University in 1983 and went on to work as a community organizer before attending law school at Harvard University.

Before becoming President, Obama served as a U.S. Senator from Illinois from 2005 to 2008. His presidency was marked by a number of key accomplishments, including the passage of the Affordable Care Act, the normalization of relations with Cuba, and the signing of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

In 2009, Obama was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to strengthen international diplomacy and cooperation between peoples. He is also known for his inspiring speeches, which have often focused on themes of hope, unity, and social justice.

Since leaving office, Obama has continued to be a prominent figure in American politics and culture. He has written several books, including a memoir about his presidency, and has been active in supporting various causes, such as climate change action and criminal justice reform.

name: Khudiram Bose
bio: Khudiram Bose was a revolutionary who participated in the Indian independence movement against British rule. He was one of the youngest freedom fighters who sacrificed his life at the age of 18 for the country's freedom.
briefBio:
Khudiram Bose was a revolutionary freedom fighter from India who is remembered for his role in the Indian independence movement. He was born on December 3, 1889, in the Midnapore district of West Bengal. Bose became involved in revolutionary activities at a young age and was inspired by the ideas of the Anushilan Samiti, a revolutionary organization.

In 1907, Bose and Prafulla Chaki attempted to assassinate a British judge, Kingsford, who was notorious for his harsh treatment of Indian freedom fighters. However, the attempt failed and Chaki died by suicide to avoid capture, while Bose was arrested and put on trial. Bose was sentenced to death and he was executed on August 11, 1908, at the age of 18.

Khudiram Bose's sacrifice and bravery inspired many young Indians to join the freedom struggle against the British. His story became a symbol of resistance and his actions were seen as a courageous example of the lengths that Indians were willing to go to achieve independence. Bose's legacy lives on in the hearts of Indians and he is remembered as a brave and selfless patriot who gave his life for his country.

name: Tom Cruise
bio: Thomas Cruise Mapother IV, known professionally as Tom Cruise, is an American actor and producer. He has been nominated for three Academy Awards and has won three Golden Globe Awards. He started his career at age 19 in the film Endless Love (1981). After portraying supporting roles in Taps (1981) and The Outsiders (1983), his first leading role was in the romantic comedy Risky Business, released in August 1983. Cruise became a full-fledged movie star after starring as Pete "Maverick" Mitchell in the action drama Top Gun (1986).
briefBio:
Tom Cruise is an American actor and producer. He was born on July 3, 1962, in Syracuse, New York.

Cruise first rose to fame in the 1980s with roles in films such as Top Gun, Risky Business, and The Color of Money. He continued to gain critical acclaim and commercial success in the following decades, with starring roles in films such as Jerry Maguire, Mission: Impossible, and Minority Report.

Cruise is known for his intense commitment to his roles, often performing his own stunts and undergoing extensive training to prepare for his performances. He has received numerous awards and nominations for his work in film, including three Academy Award nominations.

In addition to his acting career, Cruise is also a producer, with credits including the Mission: Impossible franchise and Jack Reacher. He is known for his close involvement in the creative process of his projects, and has been praised for his leadership skills and work ethic.

Cruise has also been involved in a number of humanitarian efforts, including working with the Make-A-Wish Foundation and supporting various disaster relief efforts.

With his magnetic screen presence and diverse range of roles, Tom Cruise remains one of the most iconic and enduring actors in Hollywood.

name: Mary Kom
bio: Mary Kom is an Indian boxer and a six-time world champion. She is the only female boxer to have won a medal in each of the first seven World Championships, and the only boxer (male or female) to have won eight World Championship medals. Kom has also won numerous other awards for her performances, including the Padma Bhushan and the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna. She is also known for her philanthropic work and has been involved in various social causes, including education, health, and women's empowerment.
briefBio:
Mary Kom, also known as "Magnificent Mary", is an Indian boxer and politician who is considered one of the greatest female boxers of all time. She was born on March 1, 1983, in Kangathei, Manipur, India. Mary Kom has won several national and international titles, including six gold medals at the World Championships and an Olympic bronze medal.

Mary Kom started her boxing career in 2000, and within a year, she won the Best Boxer Award at the First State Level Invitation Tournament in Manipur. She then won her first international medal at the Asian Women's Boxing Championship in 2003, and since then, there has been no looking back.

Apart from her successful boxing career, Mary Kom is also a member of the Rajya Sabha, the upper house of the Indian Parliament. She is also actively involved in social work and has been appointed as the brand ambassador for various campaigns, including the Beti Bachao Beti Padhao campaign.

Mary Kom's achievements have made her an inspiration for many young women in India and around the world. She has received numerous awards and honours for her contribution to the field of sports, including the Padma Shri, Padma Bhushan, and Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award.

name: Robert De Niro
origin: New York City, New York, USA
bio: Robert De Niro is an American actor, producer, and director. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of all time and has won numerous awards, including two Academy Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Award. De Niro has appeared in many iconic films throughout his career, including The Godfather Part II, Taxi Driver, Raging Bull, and Goodfellas.
briefBio:
Robert De Niro is an American actor, producer, and director. He was born on August 17, 1943, in New York City. De Niro started his acting career in the 1960s and gained critical acclaim for his roles in films such as "The Godfather: Part II" (1974), "Taxi Driver" (1976), and "Raging Bull" (1980).

Over the course of his career, De Niro has received numerous awards and accolades, including two Academy Awards for Best Actor for his performances in "Raging Bull" and "The Godfather: Part II". He has also been nominated for an additional five Academy Awards and eight Golden Globe Awards.

In addition to his acting career, De Niro is also a successful producer and has founded his own production company, Tribeca Productions. He has directed several films, including "A Bronx Tale" (1993) and "The Good Shepherd" (2006).

De Niro has also been involved in various humanitarian efforts and social causes, including raising awareness for autism research and environmental issues. He remains one of the most respected and influential actors in Hollywood.

name: Beyoncé Knowles
bio: Beyoncé is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and entrepreneur who rose to fame as a member of the R&B girl group Destiny's Child. She has since become one of the most successful and influential musicians of all time, known for her powerful vocals, energetic performances, and empowering messages.
briefBio:
Beyoncé Knowles is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and record producer. Born on September 4, 1981, in Houston, Texas, she rose to fame as a member of the R&B girl group Destiny's Child, which became one of the best-selling girl groups of all time.

After Destiny's Child disbanded, Beyoncé launched a successful solo career, releasing a string of hit albums and singles. She is known for her powerful vocals, elaborate stage performances, and innovative music videos. Beyoncé's music often addresses themes of love, empowerment, and social justice.

In addition to her music career, Beyoncé has also ventured into acting, starring in films such as Dreamgirls and The Lion King. She has also been involved in various philanthropic endeavors, including founding the BeyGOOD initiative, which supports various charitable causes.

Beyoncé's impact on popular culture has been significant. She has been called one of the most influential artists of all time, and her music and performances have inspired countless artists and fans around the world. She has won numerous awards throughout her career, including 28 Grammy Awards, making her the most awarded female artist in Grammy history.

Beyond her artistic achievements, Beyoncé has also been recognized for her activism and advocacy, particularly in promoting Black culture and racial justice. She is a powerful role model for young women and girls, and her influence is likely to be felt for years to come.

name: Alice Walton
bio: Alice Louise Walton is an American businesswoman and philanthropist. She is the daughter of Walmart founder Sam Walton and the sister of Walmart CEO Doug McMillon. She is the co-founder of the Walton Family Foundation, which has donated more than $1.5 billion to charitable causes.
briefBio:
Alice Walton is an American heiress and businesswoman. She was born on October 7, 1949, in Newport, Arkansas. She is the daughter of Walmart founder Sam Walton and the sister of Rob and Jim Walton.

Alice Walton is the richest woman in the world, with a net worth of over $70 billion. She inherited a portion of her father's wealth, which she has since expanded through her involvement in various business ventures.

In addition to her business activities, Walton is known for her philanthropic work. She has donated millions of dollars to support education and other causes. She is also an art collector and has founded the Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Arkansas. The museum houses her personal collection of American art, including works by artists such as Andy Warhol, Norman Rockwell, and Georgia O'Keeffe.

Walton has also been involved in various environmental initiatives, and is a member of the board of directors of the Walton Family Foundation, which supports organizations that promote environmental sustainability, education, and economic development.

Despite her immense wealth, Walton is known for leading a relatively private life. She currently resides in Fort Worth, Texas, and is not involved in the day-to-day operations of Walmart.

name: Ryan Reynolds
bio: Ryan Reynolds is a Canadian actor and producer known for his roles in films like Deadpool, The Proposal, and Safe House. He started his career in the 1990s in Canadian TV shows and later moved to Hollywood. He is also the founder of the production company, Maximum Effort Productions. Reynolds is known for his witty sense of humor and his dedication to his craft. He has won several awards throughout his career, including a Golden Globe nomination for his performance in the film Deadpool.
briefBio:
Ryan Reynolds is a Canadian actor, producer, and entrepreneur known for his roles in numerous movies and television shows. He was born on October 23, 1976, in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Reynolds began his acting career in the early 1990s, appearing in several television shows and movies. However, it was his role in the comedy film "Van Wilder" in 2002 that brought him widespread recognition.

Since then, Reynolds has appeared in numerous successful movies, including "The Proposal," "Deadpool," and "Deadpool 2." He has been nominated for several awards, including a Golden Globe for his role in "Deadpool." In addition to acting, Reynolds is also a successful entrepreneur. He has founded several businesses, including a gin brand called Aviation American Gin, which he sold for $610 million in 2020.

Reynolds is also known for his philanthropic efforts. He and his wife, actress Blake Lively, have donated millions of dollars to various charities and organizations. In 2019, they donated $2 million to help migrant children who were separated from their families at the US-Mexico border. Reynolds is also an advocate for mental health awareness and has spoken openly about his struggles with anxiety.

In addition to his acting and business ventures, Reynolds is also a family man. He has three daughters with his wife Blake Lively and often shares candid and humorous moments from their family life on social media.

name: Mahendra Singh Dhoni
bio:
Mahendra Singh Dhoni is a former Indian cricketer and captain of the Indian national cricket team. He was born on July 7, 1981, in Ranchi, Jharkhand. Dhoni is widely regarded as one of the greatest cricket captains of all time, leading India to victories in the 2007 ICC World Twenty20, the 2010 and 2016 Asia Cups, and the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup. He is also one of the most successful Indian captains in Test cricket. Dhoni was known for his calm demeanor, strategic mind, and excellent wicketkeeping skills. He is considered as one of the best finishers in limited-overs cricket. 

Dhoni announced his retirement from international cricket on August 15, 2020. However, he continues to play in the Indian Premier League (IPL) for the Chennai Super Kings (CSK), which he has captained since 2008.
briefBio:
Mahendra Singh Dhoni, also known as MS Dhoni, is a former Indian cricketer and captain of the Indian national team. Dhoni was born on July 7, 1981, in Ranchi, Jharkhand, India. He is considered one of the greatest cricketing captains in the history of Indian cricket.

Dhoni started his cricket career as a wicketkeeper-batsman and made his debut for the Indian cricket team in 2004. He gained widespread recognition for his performance in the 2005 ICC Trophy, where he led India to victory. He became the captain of the Indian cricket team in 2007 and led India to victory in the 2007 ICC World Twenty20 and the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup.

Dhoni is known for his calm and composed demeanor on the field and his ability to lead his team to victory under pressure situations. He is also known for his excellent wicketkeeping skills and his aggressive batting style.

Dhoni retired from international cricket in August 2020, leaving behind a legacy of exceptional captaincy and a long list of achievements. He continues to play domestic cricket for the Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League.

name: Nicole Kidman
bio: Nicole Kidman is a highly acclaimed actress and producer who has won an Academy Award, two Primetime Emmy Awards, and five Golden Globe Awards. She has been named one of the 100 most influential people in the world by Time magazine on two occasions. Kidman is known for her roles in films such as Moulin Rouge!, The Hours, and Big Little Lies.
briefBio:
Nicole Kidman is an Australian actress, producer and philanthropist, known for her versatile performances across different genres in Hollywood films, television shows and stage productions. She was born on June 20, 1967, in Honolulu, Hawaii to Australian parents and was raised in Sydney, Australia.

Kidman made her acting debut in the Australian film industry with the movie ‘Bush Christmas’ in 1983, and gained international recognition with her roles in films like ‘Dead Calm’ (1989), ‘To Die For’ (1995), and ‘Moulin Rouge!’ (2001). She has won numerous awards including an Academy Award, two Primetime Emmy Awards, and five Golden Globe Awards.

Kidman has worked extensively in the entertainment industry, both as an actress and producer. She has acted in numerous films such as ‘The Hours’ (2002), ‘The Others’ (2001), ‘Cold Mountain’ (2003), ‘The Interpreter’ (2005), ‘Lion’ (2016), and ‘The Prom’ (2020). In addition to acting, Kidman has also produced several films and television shows through her production company, Blossom Films.

Outside of her acting career, Kidman is known for her philanthropic work and activism, particularly in the areas of women's rights and promoting the health and well-being of children. She has been an ambassador for UNICEF since 1994 and has supported numerous charities and causes over the years.

name: Nicola Tesla
bio: Nicola Tesla was a Serbian-American inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, physicist, and futurist who is best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current (AC) electricity supply system. He is also known for his numerous patents related to the transmission and generation of electricity. He is widely regarded as one of the most important inventors of the 20th century.
briefBio:
Nikola Tesla (1856-1943) was a Serbian-American inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, and futurist who is best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current (AC) electricity supply system. He was a pioneer in the field of electrical engineering, with over 300 patents to his name, and is often referred to as one of the most important inventors of the modern age.

Tesla was born in Smiljan, Croatia, but spent most of his adult life in the United States. He began his career working for Thomas Edison, but the two had a falling out over their differing views on the use of direct current (DC) versus alternating current (AC). Tesla went on to develop the first AC motor and generator, as well as a system for transmitting electricity wirelessly.

In addition to his work in electrical engineering, Tesla also made contributions to the fields of robotics, computer science, and nuclear physics. He envisioned a world powered by clean, renewable energy, and even proposed the idea of a "world wireless system" for the transmission of information and energy.

Despite his numerous contributions to science and technology, Tesla died penniless and relatively unknown. However, his legacy has lived on, and he is widely regarded as a visionary and genius whose ideas were far ahead of his time.

name: Dwayne Johnson
bio: Dwayne Douglas Johnson, also known by his ring name The Rock, is an American actor, producer, and semi-retired professional wrestler. He is a third-generation professional wrestler, the son of professional wrestler Rocky Johnson and the late professional wrestler and actress Ata Johnson. He is of Black Nova Scotian and Irish descent.
briefBio:
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is an American actor, producer, and retired professional wrestler. He was born on May 2, 1972, in Hayward, California.

Johnson first rose to fame as a professional wrestler in the late 1990s, and quickly became one of the biggest stars in the industry. He is known for his charismatic personality and larger-than-life persona, as well as his signature moves, such as the People's Elbow and the Rock Bottom. Johnson won multiple championships during his wrestling career, including the WWE Championship and the Intercontinental Championship.

After retiring from wrestling, Johnson turned his attention to acting, and has since become one of Hollywood's most bankable stars. He has appeared in a number of films, including the Fast and Furious franchise, Jumanji, and Moana. Johnson is also a successful producer, and has produced several films and television shows, including Ballers and Young Rock.

Johnson is known for his philanthropic work, and has been involved with a number of charities, including Make-A-Wish Foundation and the Dwayne Johnson Rock Foundation, which aims to help at-risk and terminally ill children.

With his undeniable charisma and talent, Johnson has become one of the most beloved and influential figures in entertainment, with a massive fan base around the world.

name: Elon Musk
profession: Entrepreneur, CEO of SpaceX and Tesla
bio: Elon Musk is a South African-born entrepreneur and business magnate who co-founded PayPal and Tesla, Inc., among other ventures. He is also the founder, CEO, and lead designer of SpaceX, where he is working to enable the colonization of Mars. Musk is known for his innovative and ambitious ideas, as well as his outspoken personality and controversial statements.
briefBio:
Elon Musk is a South African-born entrepreneur, inventor, engineer, and CEO of several companies, including SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink, and The Boring Company. He is widely known for his innovative thinking and ambitious projects aimed at transforming various industries.

Musk's early career began with co-founding Zip2, a web software company that was eventually sold for over $300 million. He later founded PayPal, an online payment system that revolutionized the fintech industry. In 2002, Musk founded SpaceX, which aims to make space travel more accessible and affordable. Through SpaceX, Musk has achieved several significant milestones, including launching the first privately funded spacecraft to reach orbit.

In addition to SpaceX, Musk is also the CEO of Tesla, a company that specializes in electric vehicles and sustainable energy. Under his leadership, Tesla has revolutionized the automotive industry by introducing electric cars that offer high performance and extended range.

Musk has also founded Neuralink, a company focused on developing brain-machine interfaces to enable humans to communicate directly with computers. Additionally, he has created The Boring Company, which aims to revolutionize transportation by creating underground tunnels for high-speed transportation.

Musk is known for his unconventional and controversial approach to business and has faced criticism for his management style and public statements. However, he remains a prominent figure in the tech industry and continues to drive innovation through his various ventures.

name: Susanne Klatten
bio: Susanne Klatten is a German billionaire businesswoman and philanthropist. She is the chairman of BMW, the world's largest luxury automaker. She is the 16th richest person in the world with a net worth of $80 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Susanne Klatten is a German businesswoman and one of the richest women in the world. She was born in 1962 in Bad Homburg, Germany, and is the daughter of Herbert and Johanna Quandt. Her family is known for its significant shareholdings in automaker BMW, as well as in other industries.

Klatten graduated from the University of Buckingham in the United Kingdom with a degree in business finance. She then worked in various positions within her family's companies, including BMW and pharmaceuticals manufacturer Altana.

In 2006, Klatten inherited a 50% stake in pharmaceuticals manufacturer Altana, which she later sold to the pharmaceutical giant, Nycomed. She then invested the proceeds into other businesses, including renewable energy company Nordex AG, carbon and graphite manufacturer SGL Group, and chemicals company Avista Oil AG.

Klatten is also known for her philanthropy work, particularly in supporting scientific research and innovation. She is a founding member of the "Joachim Herz Stiftung," which promotes scientific research and education in Germany. She has also supported various charities, including the SOS Children's Villages, which provides care and support for children in need.

As of 2021, Forbes estimates Klatten's net worth at around $27 billion, making her one of the wealthiest women in the world.

name: Larry Page
bio: Lawrence Edward Page is an American computer scientist and Internet entrepreneur who co-founded Google with Sergey Brin. He is the CEO of Alphabet Inc., Google's parent company. Page is considered one of the pioneers of the field of web search and was ranked as the 9th most influential person in the world by Time magazine in 2013.
briefBio:
Larry Page is an American computer scientist and entrepreneur. He was born on March 26, 1973, in Lansing, Michigan.

Page is best known as the co-founder of Google, one of the world's largest and most influential technology companies. He played a key role in the development of Google's search algorithm and helped to build the company into the dominant force in online search and advertising.

In addition to his work with Google, Page has been involved in a number of other technology ventures, including developing the autonomous vehicle company Waymo and investing in the renewable energy startup Makani Power.

Page is known for his forward-thinking approach to technology and innovation, and has been recognized for his contributions to the industry with a number of awards and honors. He has also been active in philanthropy, supporting initiatives related to health, education, and the environment.

Despite his success, Page has also faced controversy in his career, including criticism of Google's handling of user data and accusations of censorship related to the company's operations in China.

With his trailblazing work in technology and his commitment to innovation and progress, Larry Page remains a significant figure in the world of tech and business.

name: Amitabh Bachchan
bio: Amitabh Bachchan is an Indian film actor who has appeared in over 200 Indian films in a career spanning five decades. He is regarded as one of the greatest actors in the history of Indian cinema and has won numerous awards for his performances, including the National Film Award for Best Actor and the Filmfare Lifetime Achievement Award. Bachchan is also a former member of the Indian Parliament.
briefBio:
Amitabh Bachchan is a renowned Indian film actor, producer, and television host who has acted in over 200 Indian films in a career spanning more than five decades. He was born on October 11, 1942, in Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India. Bachchan's father Harivansh Rai Bachchan was a renowned poet, and his mother Teji Bachchan was a social activist.

Bachchan made his debut in Hindi cinema in 1969 with the film "Saat Hindustani" and rose to fame with films like "Zanjeer", "Deewaar", and "Sholay" in the 1970s. He has won numerous awards for his acting, including the National Film Award for Best Actor and the Filmfare Lifetime Achievement Award.

Apart from acting, Bachchan has also hosted several seasons of the popular Indian game show "Kaun Banega Crorepati". He has also worked as a playback singer and has lent his voice to several songs in his films.

Bachchan has been involved in several social causes throughout his career, including supporting the fight against tuberculosis and promoting polio vaccination. In 2020, he also played an active role in spreading awareness about COVID-19 and urged people to take precautions and follow guidelines.

Bachchan's contribution to Indian cinema has been widely recognized, and he has been honored with several awards, including the Padma Shri, Padma Bhushan, and Padma Vibhushan by the Government of India.

name: Amancio Ortega
bio: Amancio Ortega Gaona is a Spanish billionaire fashion magnate, the founder and chairman of Inditex, the world's largest apparel retailer. He is the 12th richest person in the world with a net worth of $80 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Amancio Ortega is a Spanish billionaire entrepreneur and founder of the Inditex fashion group, which owns the popular clothing brand Zara. He was born on March 28, 1936, in Busdongo de Arbás, León, Spain. As of 2022, he is the second richest man in Europe and the seventh richest person in the world, with an estimated net worth of over $80 billion.

Ortega started his career as a delivery boy for a clothing store in Galicia, Spain. He eventually became a salesperson and then a manager before founding his own company, which later became Inditex. Ortega's business philosophy focuses on delivering fashionable clothing at affordable prices with quick production turnaround times. Zara's success has made Ortega one of the wealthiest people in the world.

In addition to his business success, Ortega is known for his philanthropic efforts. He has donated millions to various causes, including education and healthcare, and he established the Amancio Ortega Foundation in 2001 to promote social welfare.

Despite his immense wealth, Ortega is known for his private lifestyle and avoidance of the media. He rarely gives interviews and is said to prefer spending time with his family and horses.

name: Ingrid Bergman
bio: Ingrid Bergman was a Swedish actress who appeared in films in Europe and Hollywood. She won three Academy Awards, two Primetime Emmy Awards, and a Tony Award throughout her career. Bergman's most notable films include 'Casablanca,' 'Gaslight,' and 'Anastasia.' She was known for her natural beauty and her ability to convey emotion through her performances.
briefBio:
Ingrid Bergman was a Swedish actress who achieved international fame during Hollywood's Golden Age. She was born on August 29, 1915, in Stockholm, Sweden, and began her acting career in Swedish and German films before making her Hollywood debut in 1939 in the film Intermezzo: A Love Story.

Bergman's early Hollywood roles included Casablanca, For Whom the Bell Tolls, and Gaslight, for which she won an Academy Award for Best Actress. She also starred in many successful films in the 1950s, such as Anastasia, The Inn of the Sixth Happiness, and Indiscreet.

Bergman's personal life was often the subject of public scrutiny due to her multiple marriages and affairs, including her highly publicized relationship with Italian director Roberto Rossellini, which resulted in a scandal and backlash from American audiences.

Despite the controversy, Bergman's talent as an actress remained undisputed, and she continued to work in film, television, and stage productions throughout her career. She received three Academy Awards for Best Actress, two Emmy Awards, and a Tony Award, among numerous other accolades.

Bergman died on August 29, 1982, in London, England, at the age of 67, leaving behind a legacy as one of the greatest actresses of the 20th century.

name: Donald Trump
origin: Queens, New York City, New York, United States
bio: Donald Trump is an American businessman, television personality, and politician who served as the 45th president of the United States from 2017 to 2021. Before entering politics, Trump was a successful real estate developer and businessman, with interests in a wide range of industries, including hotels, golf courses, and casinos. He is also known for his appearances on the reality television show 'The Apprentice'. Trump announced his candidacy for president in 2015 and ran as the Republican nominee, defeating Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton in the 2016 election. During his presidency, Trump pursued an America First policy, focusing on trade, immigration, and national security. He was impeached by the House of Representatives twice during his presidency, but was acquitted both times by the Senate. Trump continues to be a controversial figure in American politics and remains active in the Republican Party.
briefBio:
Donald Trump is a businessman and politician who served as the 45th President of the United States from 2017 to 2021.
