He was born on June 14, 1946, in Queens, New York, and grew up in a wealthy family that was involved in real estate development. After attending Fordham University and the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, Trump began working for his family's business, eventually becoming the president of the Trump Organization.

In addition to his business career, Trump became involved in politics in the 1980s and was a vocal advocate for conservative issues. He flirted with presidential runs in 1988, 2000, and 2012, but did not officially launch a campaign until 2015. Running on a platform of economic nationalism and "America First" policies, Trump won the Republican nomination and went on to defeat Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton in the 2016 presidential election.

During his presidency, Trump was known for his unconventional approach to governing and his frequent use of social media to communicate directly with the American people. He was impeached twice by the House of Representatives, first in 2019 over his dealings with Ukraine, and again in 2021 over his role in inciting the January 6th insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Despite his controversial tenure, Trump remains a prominent figure in American politics and continues to be a divisive figure in the country.

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
bio: Dwight D. Eisenhower was the 34th President of the United States, serving from 1953 to 1961. He was a highly successful military leader during World War II, serving as Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces in Europe. As president, he oversaw the early years of the Cold War and the beginning of the Civil Rights Movement.
briefBio:
Dwight D. Eisenhower, also known as "Ike," was the 34th President of the United States, serving from 1953 to 1961. He was born on October 14, 1890, in Denison, Texas, and raised in Kansas. Eisenhower graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point in 1915 and went on to serve in the US Army, eventually becoming a five-star general and Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces in Europe during World War II.

After the war, Eisenhower served as president of Columbia University and as the first Supreme Commander of NATO before being elected President of the United States in 1952. During his presidency, Eisenhower oversaw the end of the Korean War and the beginning of the Cold War. He also implemented policies to promote civil rights, such as desegregating schools and the military.

Eisenhower's presidency was marked by a strong focus on national defense and foreign policy, including the development of the U-2 spy plane and the creation of the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare. He also authorized the creation of NASA, which led to the space race between the United States and the Soviet Union.

Eisenhower's presidency is often remembered for his farewell address in which he warned against the dangers of the "military-industrial complex" and the need to maintain a balance between national defense and domestic priorities. He died on March 28, 1969, in Washington, D.C., at the age of 78.

name: Mukesh Ambani
bio: Mukesh Dhirubhai Ambani is an Indian business magnate, investor, and philanthropist. He is the chairman, managing director, and largest shareholder of Reliance Industries Limited, a Fortune Global 500 company and India's most valuable company by market value. He is the richest person in India and the 7th richest person in the world with a net worth of $80 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Mukesh Ambani is an Indian billionaire businessman and the chairman and largest shareholder of Reliance Industries Limited (RIL), a conglomerate with interests in petrochemicals, refining, oil and gas exploration, retail, and telecommunications. He was born on April 19, 1957, in Aden, Yemen.

Ambani joined RIL in 1981, and became the chairman and managing director of the company in 2002, after the death of his father, Dhirubhai Ambani. Under his leadership, RIL has grown into one of the largest companies in India and has expanded its global presence.

Ambani is known for his ambitious plans and innovative business strategies. He led the launch of Jio, a mobile network that has disrupted the telecommunications industry in India with its low-cost data plans. He has also been involved in the development of several large-scale projects, including the world's largest refinery complex in Gujarat, and a new smart city development called Jio World Centre in Mumbai.

Ambani is considered one of the wealthiest people in Asia and has been recognized for his contributions to business and industry with numerous awards and honors. He is also known for his philanthropic work, and has donated large sums of money to support education and healthcare initiatives in India.

name: Keanu Reeves
bio: Keanu Charles Reeves is a Canadian actor, producer, and musician. He is best known for his acting career, beginning in 1985 and spanning more than three decades. He is best known for his starring roles in several blockbuster films, including comedies from the Bill & Ted franchise, action thrillers such as Speed and The Matrix trilogy, and romantic dramas such as A Walk to Remember and The Lake House.
briefBio:
Keanu Reeves is a Canadian actor, producer, and musician. He was born on September 2, 1964, in Beirut, Lebanon, and raised in Toronto, Canada.

Reeves first gained recognition in the 1980s with roles in films such as Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure and Point Break. He went on to star in a number of successful films in the following decades, including Speed, The Matrix trilogy, and John Wick.

Known for his stoic yet charismatic screen presence, Reeves has become a beloved figure in Hollywood and has amassed a dedicated fan base. In addition to his acting work, he is also a talented musician and has played in bands such as Dogstar and Becky.

Reeves has been praised for his charitable work, including his support of cancer research and children's hospitals. He is also known for his down-to-earth personality and humble approach to fame.

Despite his success, Reeves has faced personal tragedies, including the deaths of his partner and daughter. However, he has remained a resilient and inspiring figure, both on and off screen.

With his enduring appeal and talent, Keanu Reeves remains one of the most beloved actors in Hollywood.

name: Jack Ma
bio: Jack Ma is a Chinese billionaire businessman and philanthropist. He is the founder and executive chairman of Alibaba Group, a multinational technology conglomerate. He is the 17th richest person in the world with a net worth of $80 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Jack Ma is a Chinese entrepreneur and one of the world's richest people. He was born on September 10, 1964, in Hangzhou, China. Ma is best known as the founder and former executive chairman of Alibaba Group, one of the world's largest e-commerce companies. He is also a philanthropist and a prominent advocate for education and entrepreneurship.

Ma grew up during the Cultural Revolution in China and had a difficult childhood. He struggled in school but eventually became an English teacher. In 1995, he founded China Yellow Pages, a business directory website, which led to the creation of Alibaba Group in 1999. The company started as an online marketplace connecting Chinese manufacturers with foreign buyers and has since expanded to include various e-commerce platforms, cloud computing, and other tech-related services.

Ma stepped down as Alibaba's executive chairman in 2019 to focus on his philanthropic efforts through the Jack Ma Foundation. The foundation is dedicated to promoting education and entrepreneurship, particularly in rural areas of China. Ma is also involved in various other philanthropic initiatives, including the One Foundation, a disaster relief organization.

Ma is widely recognized for his contributions to China's tech industry and for his charismatic leadership style. He has been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people several times and was also a member of the International Olympic Committee. Despite his success, Ma has faced criticism for his outspoken views on government regulations and the political climate in China.

name: Jessica Cox
profession: Motivational Speaker, Pilot, and Disability Rights Advocate
bio:
Jessica Cox is a motivational speaker, pilot, and disability rights advocate from Tucson, Arizona. She was born without arms due to a rare birth defect but has not let her disability hold her back. She became the first person without arms to earn a pilot's license, and has since flown planes all over the world. Cox is also a black belt in Taekwondo, and has earned multiple awards for her advocacy work on behalf of people with disabilities. 

Cox uses her experiences to inspire others to break through their own limitations and achieve their dreams, no matter what obstacles they face. She has given speeches at conferences and events around the world, and has been featured in numerous media outlets. Cox is also the subject of a documentary film called 'Right Footed', which tells her life story and chronicles her journey to become a pilot.
briefBio:
Jessica Cox is the first licensed armless pilot and motivational speaker who has achieved a lot despite being born without arms due to a rare birth defect. She learned to use her feet to do everyday tasks and has become an advocate for people with disabilities.

Cox has a Bachelor of Arts degree in Psychology from the University of Arizona and a black belt in taekwondo. In 2008, she earned her pilot's license and became the first person without arms to fly an airplane. She is also a scuba diver, a surfer, and a musician.

Cox has received numerous awards for her advocacy work and inspirational speaking, including the Guinness World Record for being the first armless person in aviation history to fly an airplane with her feet.

She travels extensively, speaking to audiences about her experiences and the importance of perseverance and the value of diversity. Cox is also involved in several nonprofit organizations that focus on supporting people with disabilities and empowering women.

Cox’s story of resilience and determination has inspired many people around the world and her achievements have challenged and changed society’s perceptions about disabilities.

name: George Washington
bio: George Washington was an American political leader, military general, and Founding Father who served as the first President of the United States from 1789 to 1797. He commanded Patriot forces in the new nation's fight for independence from Great Britain, leading the Continental Army to victory over the British in 1783. Washington presided at the Constitutional Convention of 1787, which established the new federal government, and he has been called the 'Father of His Country' for his leadership in building the new nation.

name: Jennifer Lawrence
bio: Jennifer Lawrence is an American actress known for her roles in several blockbuster films, including the Hunger Games series, Silver Linings Playbook, and American Hustle. She was born on August 15, 1990, in Indian Hills, Kentucky, and began acting at a young age, making her debut in the television series Monk at the age of 16. She gained critical acclaim for her performance in the indie drama Winter's Bone in 2010, and her career skyrocketed from there. Lawrence has been nominated for four Academy Awards and has won one, for her role in Silver Linings Playbook.
briefBio:
Jennifer Lawrence is a popular American actress known for her versatile roles in Hollywood. She was born on August 15, 1990, in Indian Hills, Kentucky. She began her acting career at the young age of 14 and made her film debut in the movie "Garden Party" in 2008. However, she gained widespread recognition for her portrayal of Ree Dolly in the independent drama "Winter's Bone" (2010), for which she received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress.

Jennifer Lawrence is also known for her role as Katniss Everdeen in "The Hunger Games" film series (2012-2015), Mystique in the "X-Men" film series (2011-2019), and her portrayal of Tiffany Maxwell in "Silver Linings Playbook" (2012), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress. She has also starred in several other successful films such as "American Hustle" (2013), "Joy" (2015), and "Passengers" (2016).

Jennifer Lawrence has received numerous accolades for her performances, including three Golden Globe Awards, one Academy Award, and a BAFTA Award. In addition to acting, she is also an outspoken advocate for various causes such as gender equality and mental health.

name: Jennifer Aniston
bio: Jennifer Aniston is a popular actress and producer who rose to fame for her role as Rachel Green in the hit TV series Friends. She has won a Primetime Emmy Award, a Golden Globe Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Award for her work. Aniston is also known for her roles in films such as Marley & Me, The Break-Up, and Dumplin'.
briefBio:
Jennifer Aniston is an American actress, producer, and businesswoman, born on February 11, 1969, in Sherman Oaks, California. She is best known for her role as Rachel Green in the popular television series Friends, which ran from 1994 to 2004. Aniston has also appeared in numerous films, including Marley & Me, The Break-Up, and Horrible Bosses.

Aniston's parents were both actors, and she began performing in school plays at a young age. She graduated from the Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts in New York City and later attended the Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts in New York City.

After several minor television roles, Aniston landed her breakout role as Rachel Green in Friends. The show became a massive success and made her a household name. Aniston received numerous awards for her performance, including a Primetime Emmy Award, a Golden Globe Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Award.

Aniston has also been involved in several philanthropic endeavors, including St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, Friends of El Faro, and Stand Up to Cancer. In addition to her acting career, she is also a successful businesswoman and co-founded the production company Echo Films. Aniston has been named one of the world's most beautiful women by various publications, and her style and fashion sense have been widely praised.

name: Steve Ballmer
bio: Steven Anthony Ballmer is an American business executive, philanthropist, and former politician. He is the former CEO of Microsoft and the former owner of the Los Angeles Clippers. Ballmer is the founder of the investment firm Cascade Investment and the co-founder of the Los Angeles Clippers. He is also a former member of the board of directors of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.
briefBio:
Steve Ballmer is an American businessman and investor. He was born on March 24, 1956, in Detroit, Michigan.

Ballmer is best known for his role as CEO of Microsoft Corporation, one of the world's largest technology companies. He joined Microsoft in 1980 as the company's first business manager, and went on to play a key role in the development of the Windows operating system and other major Microsoft products.

During his time as CEO, Ballmer oversaw a period of significant growth and expansion for Microsoft, as the company expanded into new markets and acquired a number of other companies.

Following his departure from Microsoft in 2014, Ballmer became an investor and philanthropist. He has focused much of his philanthropic work on improving public education in the United States, and has donated millions of dollars to support education-related initiatives.

Ballmer is known for his high-energy and enthusiastic leadership style, and has been recognized for his contributions to the technology industry with a number of awards and honors.

name: Jawaharlal Nehru
bio: Jawaharlal Nehru was an Indian independence activist and, subsequently, the first Prime Minister of India, serving from 1947 until his death in 1964. Nehru was a central figure in Indian politics before and after independence, and is considered to be the architect of the modern Indian nation-state.
briefBio:
Jawaharlal Nehru was an Indian politician, freedom fighter, and the first Prime Minister of independent India. He was born on November 14, 1889, in Allahabad, British India. Nehru came from a wealthy family, and he was educated in England, where he studied at Harrow School and then at Trinity College, Cambridge. After returning to India, he became involved in the Indian independence movement and was eventually appointed as the President of the Indian National Congress.

Nehru played a key role in negotiating India's independence from British rule and became the country's first Prime Minister in 1947, a position he held until his death in 1964. He was known for his progressive and socialist political views and implemented several social and economic reforms, such as land reforms, the establishment of public-sector enterprises, and the promotion of secularism and democracy in India.

Nehru was also an advocate of non-alignment in foreign policy, which sought to maintain friendly relations with all countries and avoid taking sides in the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union. He was a prolific writer and authored several books, including the famous autobiography "The Discovery of India". Nehru's legacy continues to influence Indian politics and society to this day, and he is widely regarded as one of the most important figures in Indian history.

name: Cristiano Ronaldo
bio: Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro, commonly known as Cristiano Ronaldo, is a Portuguese professional football player. He was born on February 5, 1985, on the island of Madeira, Portugal. Ronaldo began his football career playing for the youth teams of Andorinha and Nacional before moving to Sporting CP's youth academy when he was 12 years old. He made his senior debut for Sporting CP in 2002 and was soon signed by Manchester United in 2003. Ronaldo played for Manchester United for six years and won numerous domestic and international titles. In 2009, he transferred to Real Madrid for a then-world record fee of €94 million. Ronaldo played for Real Madrid for nine years, where he won numerous domestic and international titles, including four UEFA Champions League titles. In 2018, he transferred to Juventus, where he currently plays.
briefBio:
Cristiano Ronaldo is a professional footballer from Portugal, widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. He was born on February 5, 1985, in Madeira, Portugal. Ronaldo began his career playing for the youth teams of Andorinha and Nacional before moving to Sporting CP at the age of 12.

In 2003, Ronaldo signed with Manchester United, where he won numerous domestic and international titles, including three Premier League titles and the UEFA Champions League. In 2009, he transferred to Real Madrid for a then-world record transfer fee of €94 million. While at Real Madrid, Ronaldo continued to break records and win titles, including four more Champions League trophies and four Ballon d'Or awards.

In 2018, Ronaldo signed with Juventus, where he continues to play to this day. He has also represented Portugal at the international level since 2003, helping his country win the European Championship in 2016 and the UEFA Nations League in 2019.

Off the pitch, Ronaldo is known for his philanthropy, including donations to various charities and the establishment of his own nonprofit organization, the Ronaldo Foundation. He is also one of the most followed celebrities on social media, with over 500 million followers across various platforms.

name: Greta Thunberg
bio: Greta Thunberg is a Swedish environmental activist who gained international recognition for her efforts to combat climate change. She first gained attention for her school strike for climate, which she began in August 2018 outside the Swedish parliament. Since then, she has become a prominent voice in the global climate movement, addressing world leaders and participating in protests and demonstrations. Thunberg has been named Time magazine's Person of the Year and has been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize.
briefBio:
Greta Thunberg is a Swedish environmental activist who gained international recognition for her efforts to combat climate change. She was born on January 3, 2003, in Stockholm, Sweden. At the age of 15, she began protesting outside the Swedish parliament building, calling for stronger action on climate change.

Her protests, which she held every Friday, sparked a global movement of young people who joined her in calling for immediate action to address climate change. Thunberg has been a vocal critic of government inaction on climate change and has called on world leaders to take urgent action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and limit global warming.

Her activism has earned her numerous awards and accolades, including Time magazine's Person of the Year in 2019 and the Right Livelihood Award, often called the 'Alternative Nobel Prize,' in 2019. In addition, she has been invited to speak at numerous international conferences and events, including the United Nations Climate Action Summit in 2019.

Thunberg's activism has inspired a generation of young people to take action on climate change and has helped to raise awareness of the urgency of the issue. Despite facing criticism and attacks from some quarters, she remains a powerful voice for climate action and continues to advocate for a more sustainable future for all.

name: Sanna Marin
bio: Sanna Marin is a Finnish politician who currently serves as the Prime Minister of Finland. Born on November 16, 1985, in Helsinki, Marin studied at the University of Tampere, where she earned a Bachelor's degree in Administrative Sciences. She was first elected to the Finnish Parliament in 2015, representing the Social Democratic Party of Finland. In December 2019, she was chosen by her party to replace outgoing Prime Minister Antti Rinne, becoming the youngest ever Prime Minister of Finland at the age of 34.
briefBio:
Sanna Marin is a Finnish politician who became the world's youngest serving prime minister when she was elected to the position in December 2019 at the age of 34. She is a member of the Social Democratic Party of Finland and has been a member of the Finnish parliament since 2015. Prior to her appointment as prime minister, she served as the Minister of Transport and Communications and was known for her advocacy for digitalization and sustainability.

Marin was born in Helsinki in 1985 and was raised by a single mother who worked in the healthcare industry. She was the first person in her family to attend university and earned a Bachelor of Administrative Sciences degree from the University of Tampere. Before entering politics, she worked as a sales representative and served as the head of her local city council.

As prime minister, Marin has advocated for progressive policies such as the introduction of a four-day workweek and a minimum wage increase. She has also been a vocal advocate for gender equality and has faced criticism for her young age and progressive views. Despite this, she remains a popular and influential figure in Finnish politics and on the global stage.

name: Joe Biden
bio: Joe Biden is an American politician who is currently serving as the 46th president of the United States. He was born on November 20, 1942, in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and later moved with his family to Wilmington, Delaware. Biden attended the University of Delaware and Syracuse Law School before embarking on a career in politics. He served as a United States senator from Delaware from 1973 to 2009 and as vice president under Barack Obama from 2009 to 2017. Biden won the 2020 presidential election against incumbent Donald Trump.
briefBio:
Joe Biden is an American politician who has served as the 46th President of the United States since January 2021. Prior to his presidency, he served as Vice President under President Barack Obama from 2009 to 2017. Biden was born on November 20, 1942, in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and grew up in a Catholic family. He graduated from the University of Delaware and Syracuse Law School and went on to work as an attorney.

Biden began his political career in 1972 when he was elected to the U.S. Senate representing Delaware. He served in the Senate for 36 years and was a respected member of the Foreign Relations Committee and the Judiciary Committee. During his time in the Senate, he also authored several important pieces of legislation, including the Violence Against Women Act.

Biden announced his candidacy for President in 2019 and went on to secure the Democratic nomination. In the 2020 election, he defeated incumbent President Donald Trump to become the oldest person ever elected to the presidency. As President, Biden has focused on a wide range of issues, including the COVID-19 pandemic, climate change, and immigration. He has also worked to restore America's relationships with its allies and to promote unity and healing within the country.

name: Steve Jobs
bio: Steve Jobs was an American entrepreneur and business magnate who co-founded Apple Inc. He is widely recognized as a pioneer of the personal computer revolution and for his influential career in the computer and consumer electronics fields. Jobs is also credited with founding Pixar Animation Studios and NeXT Inc. He was known for his creative vision, attention to detail, and his ability to anticipate and shape consumer trends. Jobs passed away in 2011 at the age of 56, leaving behind a legacy of innovation and entrepreneurship.
briefBio:
Steve Jobs was an American entrepreneur and inventor, and co-founder of Apple Inc. He was born on February 24, 1955, in San Francisco, California, and passed away on October 5, 2011, in Palo Alto, California.

Jobs is widely regarded as one of the most important figures in the history of the personal computer industry. He co-founded Apple in 1976 with Steve Wozniak and Ronald Wayne, and helped to develop and market the Apple II, one of the first commercially successful personal computers. Jobs was also instrumental in the development of the Macintosh, the iPod, the iPhone, and the iPad, which revolutionized the technology industry and changed the way people interact with technology.

In addition to his work at Apple, Jobs also co-founded and served as CEO of Pixar Animation Studios, which produced blockbuster films such as Toy Story, Finding Nemo, and The Incredibles.

Jobs was known for his uncompromising vision and attention to detail, and his innovative products and designs have had a profound impact on the world. He was also a charismatic and controversial figure, and his leadership style and business practices were the subject of much discussion and debate.

Despite his untimely death in 2011, Jobs' legacy continues to inspire and influence the technology industry and beyond.

name: Thomas Edison
bio: Thomas Edison was an American inventor and businessman who developed many devices that greatly influenced life around the world, including the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and a long-lasting, practical electric light bulb. He is widely regarded as one of the most important inventors of the 20th century.
briefBio:
Thomas Edison was an American inventor and businessman who is best known for his contributions to the development of the electric power industry. Born in 1847 in Milan, Ohio, Edison was the youngest of seven children. He had little formal education and was largely self-taught. Edison was a prolific inventor, holding over 1,000 patents for his inventions, including the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and the incandescent light bulb. He was also responsible for developing the first power station and distribution system, which paved the way for the widespread use of electricity in the United States.

Edison was known for his determination and hard work. He famously said, "Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration." He was a tireless experimenter and was known for his ability to work long hours without rest. Despite numerous setbacks and failures, Edison never gave up on his quest for innovation.

Edison was also a successful businessman, founding the Edison Electric Light Company in 1878. He was a pioneer of the modern research laboratory and was responsible for many innovations in industrial research and development. His legacy continues to be felt today, with his inventions and innovations still shaping the modern world.

name: Emma Stone
bio: Emily Jean 'Emma' Stone is an American actress. She is the recipient of numerous accolades, including an Academy Award and a Golden Globe Award. Stone began acting as a child as a member of the Valley Youth Theatre in Phoenix, Arizona, where she made her stage debut in a production of ‘The Wind in the Willows’. She gained wider recognition for her roles in the teen comedy ‘Easy A’, the drama ‘The Help’ and the musical comedy-drama ‘La La Land’.
briefBio:
Emma Stone is an American actress who is best known for her versatile roles in films ranging from comedies to dramas. Born on November 6, 1988, in Scottsdale, Arizona, Stone moved to Los Angeles with her family when she was a teenager to pursue an acting career. She got her start in the industry with small television roles before making her film debut in 2007's "Superbad."

Stone's breakthrough role came in 2010's "Easy A," in which she played a high school student who becomes notorious after pretending to have sex with several classmates. The role earned her a Golden Globe nomination for Best Actress in a Comedy or Musical. She went on to star in a number of critically acclaimed films, including "The Help," "Birdman," and "La La Land," for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress.

Stone has also been recognized for her work outside of acting, including her advocacy for causes such as mental health awareness and gender equality. She has been involved with several organizations that work to support women's rights and has spoken publicly about her own experiences with anxiety.

In addition to her film work, Stone has also appeared on stage, making her Broadway debut in the 2014 revival of "Cabaret." She has also hosted "Saturday Night Live" multiple times and has been a guest on several talk shows.

name: Ada Lovelace
bio: Ada Lovelace was an English mathematician and writer, chiefly known for her work on Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. She is regarded as the first computer programmer.
briefBio:
Ada Lovelace was a 19th-century English mathematician and writer who is widely regarded as the world's first computer programmer. She was born on December 10, 1815, in London, England.

Lovelace is known for her work on Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. She wrote a set of instructions for the machine that included an algorithm intended to be carried out by the machine, making her the world's first computer programmer.

Lovelace's work on the Analytical Engine laid the groundwork for modern computing, and her insights into the potential of computing technology were ahead of their time. She also played an important role in shaping the development of computing as a field, and her work has had a profound impact on the world of technology.

Beyond her contributions to computing, Lovelace was also an accomplished writer and thinker. She was known for her wit and intelligence and was a prominent figure in the intellectual circles of her time.

Lovelace's legacy continues to inspire and influence people around the world, particularly in the fields of computing and technology. Her life and work serve as a reminder of the power of innovation and creativity and the importance of diversity and inclusion in shaping the future.

name: Mark Zuckerberg
bio: Mark Zuckerberg is an American entrepreneur and software developer who co-founded Facebook, the world's largest social networking website. He is also known for his philanthropic efforts through the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. As of February 2023, his net worth is estimated to be $107.2 billion.
briefBio:
Mark Zuckerberg is an American entrepreneur and the founder and CEO of Facebook, one of the world's largest social media platforms. He was born on May 14, 1984, in White Plains, New York.

Zuckerberg founded Facebook in 2004, while he was still a student at Harvard University. The social media platform quickly became a global phenomenon, with over 2 billion active users as of 2021. Under Zuckerberg's leadership, Facebook has expanded to include a number of other platforms, including Instagram and WhatsApp.

Zuckerberg is known for his innovative vision and entrepreneurial spirit, and he has been credited with revolutionizing the way people interact and communicate online. He has also been involved in a number of philanthropic ventures, including the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, which aims to promote education and scientific research.

Despite his success, Zuckerberg has faced criticism over a number of issues, including Facebook's handling of user data and the platform's role in the spread of misinformation and hate speech. He has also been accused of anticompetitive practices and faced calls for increased regulation of social media platforms.

Despite these challenges, Zuckerberg remains one of the most influential and successful entrepreneurs of his generation, with a legacy that is sure to endure for years to come.

name: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
profession: Former Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
bio: Ruth Bader Ginsburg was an American jurist who served as an associate justice of the Supreme Court of the United States from 1993 until her death in 2020. She was known for her advocacy for gender equality and women's rights, and was the second woman to serve on the Supreme Court.
briefBio:
Ruth Bader Ginsburg was an American lawyer and jurist who served as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States from 1993 until her death in 2020. She was born on March 15, 1933, in Brooklyn, New York.

Ginsburg was known for her advocacy of gender equality and women's rights, and her work as a lawyer and judge helped to shape the legal landscape in the United States. She argued several landmark cases before the Supreme Court, including United States v. Virginia, which struck down the male-only admission policy of the Virginia Military Institute, and Olmstead v. L.C., which affirmed the right of individuals with disabilities to receive care in their communities.

Ginsburg's career and accomplishments have made her a role model for women and a symbol of progress and change. She was the second woman to serve on the Supreme Court and was known for her steadfast commitment to justice and equality.

Despite her passing, Ginsburg's legacy continues to inspire and motivate people around the world. Her life and career serve as a reminder of the importance of fighting for equality and justice, and her impact on the legal profession and society as a whole will be felt for generations to come.

name: Albert Einstein
origin: Ulm, Kingdom of Württemberg, German Empire
bio: Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics. His work is also known for its influence on the philosophy of science. He is best known to the general public for his mass-energy equivalence formula E=mc².
briefBio:
Albert Einstein was a German-born physicist who is widely regarded as one of the most influential scientists of the 20th century. He was born on March 14, 1879, in Ulm, Germany, and is best known for his theory of relativity, which revolutionized our understanding of space and time.

Einstein's work on relativity and other groundbreaking contributions to physics earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921. He also made significant contributions to the development of quantum mechanics and statistical mechanics.

Beyond his scientific work, Einstein was also known for his pacifist views and advocacy for social justice. He was a vocal critic of war and militarism, and his activism earned him both praise and criticism.

Einstein immigrated to the United States in 1933 to escape the rise of Nazism in Germany, and he became a US citizen in 1940. He continued to work on scientific research and advocacy throughout his life, and his legacy continues to inspire scientists and activists around the world.

Einstein's contributions to physics and his advocacy for peace and justice have earned him a place among the most important figures in modern history. His work continues to shape our understanding of the universe, and his advocacy for social causes serves as an inspiration to generations of activists.

name: Ajinkya Rahane
bio: Ajinkya Rahane is an Indian cricketer who plays as a middle-order batsman for the Indian national cricket team. He has scored over 4,500 runs in Test cricket and is known for his solid defensive technique. Rahane has also served as the captain of the Indian cricket team on several occasions.
briefBio:
Ajinkya Rahane is an Indian cricketer who is known for his dependable batting and agile fielding skills. He was born on June 6, 1988, in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. Rahane is a right-handed batsman and a part-time bowler. He made his debut for the Indian cricket team in 2011 and has since become a consistent performer in all formats of the game.

Rahane's style of play is characterized by his technique and temperament. He is known for his solid defense and ability to play long innings, which has earned him the nickname "Mr. Dependable". His strong work ethic and commitment to his craft have earned him the respect of his teammates and opponents alike.

Rahane has been a vital member of the Indian cricket team for many years, particularly in Test cricket. He has scored over 4000 runs in Test cricket at an average of around 41, with 12 centuries to his name. He has also played in limited-overs formats for India and has shown his ability to score quickly when needed.

Off the field, Rahane is known for his humility and his quiet, unassuming nature. He has been involved in various philanthropic initiatives, including supporting education for underprivileged children. Rahane's leadership skills were also recognized when he was appointed as the captain of the Indian cricket team for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia in 2020-21, where he led the team to a historic series victory.

name: Bernard Arnault
bio: Bernard Arnault is a French businessman and art collector. He is the CEO of LVMH, the world's largest luxury goods company, which includes brands such as Louis Vuitton, Dior, and Moët & Chandon. As of February 2023, his net worth is estimated to be $171.3 billion.
briefBio:
Bernard Arnault is a French businessman and the CEO of LVMH, a multinational luxury goods conglomerate. He was born on March 5, 1949, in Roubaix, France.

Arnault is one of the richest people in the world, with a net worth of over $150 billion as of 2021. Under his leadership, LVMH has grown to become the world's largest luxury goods company, with brands such as Louis Vuitton, Dior, Fendi, and Givenchy.

Arnault is known for his shrewd business acumen and strategic vision, and he has been credited with transforming the luxury goods industry through his innovative marketing and branding strategies. He is also a noted philanthropist, having donated millions of dollars to various charitable causes, including the fight against COVID-19.

Despite his enormous wealth and influence, Arnault has faced criticism over his company's environmental impact and labor practices. However, he has taken steps to address these concerns, such as setting targets for reducing the company's carbon footprint and implementing policies to improve working conditions for employees.

Arnault's legacy as a business leader and philanthropist is sure to endure for generations to come, as he continues to shape the luxury goods industry and make a positive impact on the world.

name: Usha Mehta
bio: Usha Mehta was a freedom fighter and an active participant in the Quit India Movement of 1942. She was also a well-known radio personality who used to broadcast patriotic songs and speeches from an underground radio station during the independence movement.
briefBio:
Usha Mehta was an Indian freedom fighter and a prominent figure in India's independence movement. She was born on March 25, 1920, in Mumbai, Maharashtra, and was educated at the St. Xavier's College, Mumbai. Usha Mehta was inspired by Mahatma Gandhi's Quit India Movement in 1942 and decided to actively participate in it. She formed the secret Congress Radio, which was a clandestine radio station that broadcasted news of the independence movement, inspiring the masses to join the struggle against the British.

Mehta was arrested in 1942 along with her colleagues and sentenced to two years in prison. After her release, she continued to participate in the independence movement and played an active role in the Samyukta Maharashtra movement, which aimed to create a separate state for Marathi-speaking people.

Usha Mehta was also a scholar and researcher of the Indian freedom movement. She established the Bhavan's Gandhi Vidyashram in Mumbai, which was dedicated to promoting the study of Gandhian thought and philosophy. Mehta was also a member of the Rajya Sabha, the upper house of the Indian parliament, and received numerous awards and honours for her contributions to the independence movement.

Usha Mehta passed away on August 11, 2000, at the age of 80. She is remembered as a courageous freedom fighter and a staunch supporter of the ideals of Mahatma Gandhi.

name: Jim Walton
bio: James Lawrence "Jim" Walton is an American businessman and philanthropist. He is the eldest son of Walmart founder Sam Walton and the brother of Walmart CEO Doug McMillon. He is the co-founder of the Walton Family Foundation, which has donated more than $1.5 billion to charitable causes.
briefBio:
Jim Walton is an American businessman and the youngest son of Walmart founder Sam Walton. He was born on June 7, 1948, in Newport, Arkansas.

Walton is currently the chairman and CEO of Arvest Bank Group, a bank holding company with branches in Arkansas, Oklahoma, Missouri, and Kansas. He is also a member of the board of directors of Walmart, the world's largest retailer, which was founded by his father and uncle.

With a net worth of over $70 billion, Walton is one of the richest people in the world. He inherited a portion of his father's wealth, which he has since expanded through his involvement in various business ventures.

Walton is known for his low-key and private lifestyle, and has largely avoided the public spotlight. He is an advocate for education and has donated millions of dollars to support education-related initiatives in Arkansas and other parts of the United States.

In addition to his business and philanthropic activities, Walton is also an avid hunter and outdoorsman. He has been involved in conservation efforts and has supported organizations that work to protect wildlife and preserve natural habitats.

name: Mahatama Gandhi
bio: Mahatama Gandhi was a lawyer and politician who led the Indian independence movement against British rule. He is considered the father of the nation and is widely regarded as one of the greatest leaders of the 20th century. He was assassinated in 1948 by a Hindu nationalist.
briefBio:
Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, also known as Mahatma Gandhi, was a prominent Indian independence activist and political leader who is recognized as the father of the nation in India. He was born on October 2, 1869, in Porbandar, Gujarat, India, and was assassinated on January 30, 1948, in New Delhi.

Gandhi was a lawyer by profession but later dedicated his life to India's struggle for independence from British rule. He is known for his philosophy of nonviolent resistance, which he called satyagraha. Gandhi led many peaceful protests and civil disobedience campaigns, including the famous Salt March, which was a turning point in India's independence movement.

Gandhi was not only a political leader but also a spiritual leader who emphasized the importance of truth, nonviolence, and self-sufficiency. He believed in the equality of all people and fought against discrimination based on caste, religion, or gender.

Gandhi's impact was not only limited to India but also influenced many civil rights leaders and movements around the world, including Martin Luther King Jr. in the United States. His teachings and principles continue to inspire people today to fight for justice, equality, and peace through nonviolent means.

In recognition of his contributions to India's independence movement and his advocacy for peace, Gandhi was nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize five times but never won. He remains an iconic figure in Indian history and a symbol of peace and nonviolence around the world.

name: Jasprit Bumrah
bio: Jasprit Bumrah is an Indian cricketer who is considered one of the best fast bowlers in the world. He has numerous records to his name, including the best figures by an Indian bowler in a Test match outside of Asia. Bumrah has received several awards for his performances, including the Polly Umrigar Award for International Cricketer of the Year in 2018 and 2019.
briefBio:
Jasprit Bumrah is an Indian cricketer who plays as a right-arm fast bowler in all formats of the game. He was born on December 6, 1993, in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. Bumrah made his debut for the Indian cricket team in 2016, and since then he has become an integral part of the team with his pace and accuracy.

Bumrah's unique bowling action, which features a short run-up and an angled arm delivery, has made him a difficult bowler to face for even the best batsmen in the world. He has been a key player for the Indian team in major tournaments, including the 2019 ICC World Cup and the 2021 ICC World Test Championship.

Bumrah has also had success in domestic cricket, playing for the Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League (IPL). He has played a key role in helping the team win multiple IPL championships. Bumrah's impressive performances have earned him numerous accolades, including the prestigious Wisden Cricketer of the Year award in 2019.

Off the field, Bumrah is known for his quiet and reserved personality. He has spoken about the importance of mental health in cricket and has been open about his struggles with anxiety. Bumrah is also an animal lover and has worked with animal welfare organizations to raise awareness about animal welfare issues.

name: Selena Gomez
bio:
Selena Marie Gomez is an American singer, actress, and producer. Born on July 22, 1992, in Grand Prairie, Texas, she began her career as a child actress on the children's television series Barney & Friends. Gomez rose to fame playing the lead role of Alex Russo in the Disney Channel television series Wizards of Waverly Place, which aired from 2007 to 2012. She has since starred in a number of successful films and television shows, including Spring Breakers, The Fundamentals of Caring, and 13 Reasons Why.

In addition to her acting career, Gomez is also an accomplished musician. She has released several successful albums and singles, including Stars Dance, Revival, and Rare. Gomez has also worked as a producer on several films and television shows, and she has launched her own clothing line, perfume line, and beauty brand. 

Throughout her career, Gomez has been recognized for her humanitarian efforts, and she has worked with a number of organizations to raise awareness of important issues such as mental health and the effects of social media on young people.
briefBio:
Selena Gomez is an American singer, actress, and producer who was born on July 22, 1992, in Grand Prairie, Texas. She started her career in the entertainment industry at a young age, appearing on the children's TV series "Barney & Friends" from 2002 to 2004. In 2007, she landed a leading role on the Disney Channel series "Wizards of Waverly Place", which brought her international recognition and fame.

Gomez's music career started in 2008, and she has released numerous successful albums and singles, including "Come & Get It", "Good for You", and "Lose You to Love Me". She has also collaborated with various artists and received numerous accolades for her music.

Apart from her music and acting career, Gomez is also an active philanthropist and has supported various causes such as UNICEF, Alliance for Children's Rights, and Lupus Research Alliance. She has also been vocal about her struggles with mental health and has advocated for mental health awareness.

Gomez has been recognized for her contributions to the entertainment industry and her philanthropic efforts, receiving various awards such as the Billboard Woman of the Year, Glamour Woman of the Year, and the Hispanic Heritage Foundation's Inspira Award.

name: Carlos Slim Helu
bio: Carlos Slim Helú is a Mexican business magnate, investor, and philanthropist. He is the chairman of Grupo Carso, the holding company of his business empire. He is the 13th richest person in the world with a net worth of $80 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Carlos Slim Helu is a Mexican businessman and philanthropist. As of 2022, he is the third richest person in the world, with an estimated net worth of over $70 billion. Born on January 28, 1940, in Mexico City, Slim made his fortune primarily in the telecommunications industry.

Slim's business empire, Grupo Carso, includes a wide range of companies, including telecommunications, finance, construction, and retail. His telecommunications company, Telmex, was once a state-owned monopoly, but Slim acquired a majority stake in the company and turned it into a private enterprise. He also owns América Móvil, one of the largest mobile phone operators in the world.

In addition to his business ventures, Slim is also known for his philanthropic efforts. He established the Carlos Slim Foundation in 1986 to promote education, healthcare, and cultural programs in Mexico and around the world. The foundation has donated millions of dollars to various causes, including disaster relief efforts.

Despite his immense wealth, Slim is known for his frugal lifestyle. He reportedly still lives in the same house he bought in 1967 and drives an older model car. Slim has also been known to advocate for economic and social reforms in Mexico, calling for a reduction in income inequality and government corruption.

name: Jane Goodall
bio: Jane Goodall is a British primatologist and anthropologist, best known for her groundbreaking research on chimpanzees. She is considered to be the world's foremost expert on chimpanzees and has dedicated her life to studying and protecting these animals and their habitats.
briefBio:
Jane Goodall is a British primatologist, anthropologist, and conservationist who has dedicated her life to studying chimpanzees and advocating for their conservation. She was born on April 3, 1934, in London, England.

Goodall's pioneering research on chimpanzee behavior challenged traditional views of primates and helped to revolutionize the field of primatology. She is known for her groundbreaking discoveries, including the use of tools by chimpanzees, and for her long-term studies of chimpanzee communities in Tanzania.

Beyond her scientific achievements, Goodall has also been a passionate advocate for conservation and environmental protection. She founded the Jane Goodall Institute, which works to protect chimpanzees and their habitats, and has been a vocal advocate for animal rights and environmental sustainability.

Goodall's work has had a profound impact on the fields of primatology and conservation, and she has been recognized with numerous awards and honors for her contributions. Her life and work serve as an inspiration to others, particularly young people, to pursue their passions and make a positive difference in the world.

name: Subhash Chandra Bose
bio: Subhash Chandra Bose was an Indian nationalist whose defiant patriotism made him a hero in India, but whose attempt during World War II to rid India of British rule with the help of Nazi Germany and Imperial Japan left a troubled legacy. Bose headed the Indian National Army, a military force created to achieve independence for India.
briefBio:
Subhas Chandra Bose, also known as Netaji, was a prominent Indian nationalist leader and a charismatic speaker. He was born on January 23, 1897, in Cuttack, Odisha, and was raised in a politically active family. Bose's ideology was based on the principles of nationalism, socialism, and militarism, and he strongly believed in achieving India's independence through armed struggle.

In 1921, Bose became the president of the Indian National Congress, but his differences with Mahatma Gandhi led to his resignation in 1939. He then formed the Forward Bloc, a left-wing nationalist party that aimed to achieve India's independence through a revolution. During World War II, Bose sought the help of Nazi Germany and Imperial Japan to overthrow British rule in India. He formed the Indian National Army (INA), also known as the Azad Hind Fauj, with Japanese assistance.

Bose's military campaign against the British in India was unsuccessful, and he died on August 18, 1945, in a plane crash in Taiwan. His death remains shrouded in mystery, and there are various theories about his fate. Bose's contributions to the Indian independence movement are widely recognized, and he is remembered as a hero and a symbol of courage and sacrifice in the struggle for freedom.

name: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan
bio: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan is an Indian actress and former Miss World who has appeared in several Bollywood and Hollywood films. She has won several awards, including two Filmfare Awards and the Padma Shri from the Government of India. She made her acting debut in the 1997 Tamil film Iruvar and went on to become one of the most popular actresses in India.
briefBio:
Aishwarya Rai Bachchan is an Indian actress, model, and former Miss World, born on November 1, 1973, in Mangalore, Karnataka, India. She made her acting debut in 1997 with the Tamil film "Iruvar" and went on to become one of the most successful actresses in Indian cinema.

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan has acted in over 40 films in multiple languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, and English. Some of her notable Bollywood films include "Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam", "Devdas", "Jodhaa Akbar", and "Guzaarish". She has won numerous awards for her performances, including two Filmfare Awards, and has been honored with the Padma Shri by the Government of India.

Apart from her acting career, Aishwarya is also known for her beauty and has been a global brand ambassador for several companies, including L'Oreal Paris. She was also named the most beautiful woman in the world by People magazine in 2004 and was honored with the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres, one of the highest civilian awards in France, in 2012.

Aishwarya is married to actor Abhishek Bachchan and the couple has a daughter named Aaradhya. She is also involved in various philanthropic activities and has supported causes such as eye donation and HIV/AIDS awareness.

name: Sheryl Sandberg
bio: Sheryl Sandberg is an American technology executive and author. She is the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Facebook and founder of Leanin.org. Sandberg began her career in the tech industry in the 1990s, working at the World Bank and Google before joining Facebook in 2008. In addition to her work at Facebook, Sandberg has written several best-selling books, including 'Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead' and 'Option B: Facing Adversity, Building Resilience, and Finding Joy'. She is also known for her advocacy for women's rights and gender equality in the workplace.
briefBio:
Sheryl Sandberg is a technology executive, author, and activist who is best known for her work as the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Facebook. Born in 1969 in Washington D.C., Sandberg grew up in a Jewish family and earned her undergraduate degree from Harvard University before obtaining her Master of Business Administration from Harvard Business School.

Prior to her tenure at Facebook, Sandberg served as a management consultant for McKinsey & Company and as the Vice President of Global Online Sales and Operations for Google. She joined Facebook in 2008 and quickly rose through the ranks to become the company's COO in 2009.

In addition to her work in the tech industry, Sandberg is also an advocate for women's rights and gender equality. She has written several books on these topics, including "Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead," which became a bestseller and inspired a global movement to support women in the workplace.

Sandberg has been recognized for her leadership and activism, receiving honors such as being named one of the world's 100 most powerful women by Forbes and one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people. She is also a member of the board of directors for several organizations, including the Walt Disney Company and Women for Women International.

name: Sundar Pichai
bio: Sundar Pichai is an Indian-American businessman who is the CEO of Google and its parent company, Alphabet Inc. He joined Google in 2004 and has since played a key role in the development of several of the company's products, including Chrome, Google Drive, and Android. Pichai was named CEO of Google in 2015 and then took over as CEO of Alphabet in 2019. He is widely regarded as one of the most influential people in the tech industry.
briefBio:
Sundar Pichai is an Indian-American businessman and the current CEO of Google LLC and its parent company, Alphabet Inc. He was born on June 10, 1972, in Chennai, India. Pichai graduated with a Bachelor of Engineering degree in Metallurgical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur. Later, he moved to the United States and obtained an MS degree from Stanford University and an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Pichai joined Google in 2004 and rose through the ranks, working on various products such as Google Chrome, Chrome OS, and Google Drive. In 2015, he was named CEO of Google, taking over from Larry Page. In 2019, he became the CEO of Alphabet Inc. as well, following the resignation of Page.

Under Pichai's leadership, Google has continued to grow and expand into new areas such as artificial intelligence, cloud computing, and hardware. He has also been an advocate for privacy and security, working to protect user data and ensure the company's products are secure.

In addition to his work at Google, Pichai serves on the board of directors of Alphabet Inc. and is a member of the board of trustees of his alma mater, the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur. He has been recognized for his leadership and innovation, receiving numerous awards and honors throughout his career.

name: Scarlett Johansson
origin: New York City, New York, U.S.
bio: Scarlett Ingrid Johansson is an American actress and singer. She is the world's highest-paid actress, has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, has made multiple appearances in the Forbes Celebrity 100, and is the recipient of several awards, including a Tony Award and a BAFTA Award. Johansson began her acting career in the Off-Broadway play ‘Sophistry’ in 1993 and made her film debut in the fantasy comedy ‘North’ in 1994. She is best known for her roles in films such as ‘Lost in Translation’, ‘The Avengers’ series, ‘Her’, ‘Marriage Story’ and ‘Jojo Rabbit’.
briefBio:
Scarlett Johansson is a highly acclaimed American actress and singer. Born on November 22, 1984, in New York City, Johansson made her film debut at the age of 9 and rose to fame in the early 2000s with her breakthrough role in the film "Lost in Translation."

Over the years, Johansson has become one of the most bankable stars in Hollywood, known for her versatility and range as an actress. She has won numerous awards and nominations for her work in films such as "Girl with a Pearl Earring," "Match Point," "The Avengers," and "Marriage Story."

Aside from her acting career, Johansson is also a talented singer and has released two albums. She has also been involved in various humanitarian and philanthropic efforts, including working with the anti-poverty organization Oxfam, and serving as an ambassador for the charity group, "Stand Up to Cancer."

Johansson is known for her beauty, intelligence, and wit, and has been named as one of the most beautiful and powerful women in the world by various publications. With her talent and dedication to her craft, Johansson continues to be one of the most sought-after actresses in Hollywood today.

name: Shubman Gill
bio: Shubman Gill is an Indian cricketer who plays as a top-order batsman for the Indian national cricket team. He made his international debut in 2019 and has since scored over 700 runs in all formats of the game. Gill is known for his elegant strokeplay and is considered one of the most promising young talents in Indian cricket.
briefBio:
Shubman Gill is an Indian cricketer who was born on September 8, 1999, in Fazilka, Punjab, India. He is a right-handed opening batsman who made his debut for the Indian cricket team in January 2019. Gill started playing cricket at the age of three and later moved to Mohali to join the Punjab Cricket Association's academy. He represented Punjab in various age-group tournaments and made his first-class debut for them in November 2017.

Gill caught the attention of the selectors with his impressive performances in the domestic circuit, which earned him a place in the Indian team for the ODI series against New Zealand in January 2019. However, he made his international debut in Test cricket against Australia in December 2018. Gill scored his maiden Test fifty in his second match against the same opposition in Melbourne.

Gill is considered as one of the brightest prospects in Indian cricket due to his impeccable technique and temperament. He has been compared to Indian batting greats such as Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid. Gill's consistent performances in the domestic circuit and his impressive showing in the limited opportunities that he has got in international cricket have made him a strong contender for a permanent spot in the Indian team across all formats.

name: Justin Bieber
bio: Justin Bieber is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and actor. He was discovered on YouTube in 2008 by talent manager Scooter Braun, and signed to Island Records. Bieber has since released multiple chart-topping albums and singles, including 'Baby,' 'Sorry,' and 'Love Yourself.' He has won numerous awards throughout his career, including a Grammy Award, 20 Billboard Music Awards, and 2 Brit Awards. In addition to his music career, Bieber has also ventured into acting, appearing in films such as 'Zoolander 2' and 'Killing Hasselhoff.'
briefBio:
Justin Bieber is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and actor who rose to fame at a young age. Born on March 1, 1994, in London, Ontario, Bieber began his career as a YouTuber, posting videos of himself singing covers of popular songs. He was discovered by music executive Scooter Braun, who saw one of his videos and signed him to a record deal.

Bieber's debut album, "My World 2.0," was released in 2010 and included the hit singles "Baby" and "Somebody to Love." He quickly became a teen sensation, known for his catchy pop hooks and boyish good looks. Over the years, Bieber has released several successful albums and collaborated with numerous artists, including Ed Sheeran, DJ Khaled, and Ariana Grande.

In addition to his music career, Bieber has also pursued acting and appeared in several films and TV shows, including "CSI: Crime Scene Investigation" and "Zoolander 2." He has also been open about his struggles with mental health and has used his platform to raise awareness about issues such as anxiety and depression.

Despite some controversial moments in his career, Bieber has remained a popular and influential figure in the music industry, with millions of devoted fans around the world.

name: Serena Williams
bio: Serena Williams is an American professional tennis player who is considered one of the greatest tennis players of all time. She has won 23 Grand Slam singles titles, the most by any player in the Open Era. She is also known for her activism and philanthropy work.
briefBio:
Serena Williams is an American professional tennis player widely regarded as one of the greatest athletes of all time. She was born on September 26, 1981, in Saginaw, Michigan, and grew up in Compton, California.

Williams has won 23 Grand Slam singles titles, the most by any player in the Open Era, and has also won 14 Grand Slam doubles titles with her sister Venus Williams. She has also won four Olympic gold medals and numerous other titles and awards throughout her career.

Beyond her success on the court, Williams has been a vocal advocate for social justice and gender equality. She has used her platform to raise awareness of issues such as police brutality and the gender pay gap in sports.

Williams has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including the Serena Williams Foundation, which aims to provide education and support for underprivileged youth.

Throughout her career, Williams has inspired countless people with her skill, determination, and advocacy. She continues to be a role model for young athletes and a powerful voice for important social causes.

name: Alluri Sitarama Raju
bio: Alluri Sitarama Raju was a revolutionary who fought against the British Raj in the forests of Andhra Pradesh. He was the leader of the Rampa Rebellion, which was one of the first tribal uprisings against the British in India.
briefBio:
Alluri Sitarama Raju (1897 – 1924) was a freedom fighter from Andhra Pradesh, India. He was known for his leadership in the Rampa Rebellion, a tribal uprising against the British colonial government in India.

Born in the Vishakhapatnam district of Andhra Pradesh, Raju was influenced by the teachings of Gandhi and Bal Gangadhar Tilak. However, he later became disillusioned with Gandhi's non-violent approach and instead advocated for armed rebellion against the British.

Raju organized and led the Rampa Rebellion in 1922, which aimed to overthrow the British colonial government and establish an independent state for the tribal people. The rebellion was initially successful in capturing several police stations and government offices, but was eventually crushed by the British.

Raju was later captured by the British and sentenced to death. He was executed on July 7, 1924, but his legacy lived on as a symbol of resistance against British rule.

Alluri Sitarama Raju is remembered as a brave and charismatic leader who fought for the rights of the oppressed and marginalized people. He is an important figure in the history of India's struggle for independence, and his contribution to the freedom movement continues to inspire generations of Indians.

name: Martin Luther King Jr.
profession: Civil rights activist, Baptist minister, and humanitarian
bio: Martin Luther King Jr. was a prominent African American civil rights activist and Baptist minister who played a key role in the American civil rights movement from the mid-1950s until his assassination in 1968. King is best known for advancing civil rights through nonviolence and civil disobedience, inspired by his Christian beliefs and the nonviolent activism of Mahatma Gandhi. King's campaigns included leading the Montgomery bus boycott and organizing the 1963 March on Washington, where he delivered his famous 'I Have a Dream' speech.
briefBio:
Martin Luther King Jr. was an American Baptist minister and civil rights activist who played a key role in the American civil rights movement from the mid-1950s until his assassination in 1968. King is best known for his nonviolent approach to social activism, which he believed was the most effective way to bring about lasting change. He led numerous peaceful protests and civil disobedience campaigns, including the Montgomery bus boycott and the March on Washington, where he delivered his famous "I Have a Dream" speech.

Born on January 15, 1929, in Atlanta, Georgia, King was the son of a Baptist minister and grew up in a religious household. He studied theology and received a Ph.D. from Boston University in 1955. King's activism was inspired by his Christian faith, and he often invoked biblical themes in his speeches and writings.

King's contributions to the civil rights movement were recognized with the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964. He continued to work towards racial equality and economic justice until his assassination on April 4, 1968, in Memphis, Tennessee. Today, King is remembered as a champion of human rights and social justice, and his legacy continues to inspire people around the world.

name: Millie Bobby Brown
bio: Millie Bobby Brown is a British actress who rose to fame for her role as Eleven in the Netflix series Stranger Things. She was born on February 19, 2004, in Marbella, Spain, and later moved to Bournemouth, England with her family. She began acting at a young age and got her first major role as a guest star on the ABC fantasy drama Once Upon a Time in Wonderland. Brown’s breakout role came in 2016 when she was cast as Eleven in Stranger Things, which earned her critical acclaim and several award nominations, including a Primetime Emmy Award nomination. Since then, she has appeared in several films and television shows, including Godzilla: King of the Monsters and Enola Holmes.
briefBio:
Millie Bobby Brown is an English actress known for her outstanding performances in film and television. She was born on February 19, 2004, in Marbella, Spain. She started her acting career in 2013 with the television series 'Once Upon a Time in Wonderland.' She rose to fame after portraying the character of 'Eleven' in the science fiction-horror series 'Stranger Things' on Netflix.

Brown's performance in 'Stranger Things' received critical acclaim and earned her several awards and nominations. In 2017, she won the 'Screen Actors Guild Award' for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series. The same year, she was also nominated for the 'Primetime Emmy Award' for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series, becoming the youngest actor ever to be nominated for this award.

Apart from 'Stranger Things,' Brown has also acted in movies such as 'Godzilla: King of the Monsters,' 'Enola Holmes,' and 'The Eternals.' She has also modeled for major fashion brands and appeared in music videos. Brown is also involved in various philanthropic activities and supports causes such as anti-bullying, children's rights, and animal welfare.

At such a young age, Brown has become one of the most sought-after actresses in the industry. With her talent, versatility, and dedication, she has already made a significant impact in the world of entertainment and is poised to achieve greater heights in the future.

name: Cheteshwar Pujara
bio: Cheteshwar Pujara is an Indian cricketer who plays as a top-order batsman for the Indian national cricket team. He is known for his solid defensive technique and has scored over 6,000 runs in Test cricket. Pujara is often referred to as the 'New Wall' of Indian cricket due to his ability to bat for long periods of time.
briefBio:
Cheteshwar Pujara is an Indian cricketer who is known for his solid and patient batting technique. Born on January 25, 1988, in Rajkot, Gujarat, he is a right-handed batsman who is also known for his exceptional fielding skills. Pujara made his debut in international cricket in 2010, and since then, he has become an integral part of the Indian Test team.

Pujara has a solid technique and is known for his ability to play long innings. He is often compared to the legendary Rahul Dravid for his patience, determination, and resilience. Pujara is particularly good at playing spin bowling and has scored many runs against some of the best spin bowlers in the world.

Pujara has played many match-winning innings for India, including his unbeaten 206 against England in 2012, which helped India win the Test match. He has also scored centuries in Australia, England, and South Africa. In 2018, Pujara played a crucial role in India's Test series victory in Australia, where he scored three centuries and was named the player of the series.

Off the field, Pujara is known for his humble and grounded personality. He is a role model for many young cricketers in India and is admired for his dedication and commitment to the game.

name: Audrey Hepburn
bio: Audrey Hepburn was a British actress and humanitarian. She is widely regarded as one of the greatest actresses of the 20th century, known for her elegance, charm, and iconic roles in films like 'Roman Holiday,' 'Sabrina,' and 'Breakfast at Tiffany's.' Hepburn won an Academy Award, a Golden Globe, and a BAFTA Award for her work in 'Roman Holiday.' In addition to her acting career, Hepburn was also a Goodwill Ambassador for UNICEF.
briefBio:
Audrey Hepburn was a British actress and humanitarian known for her delicate and charming demeanor both on and off screen. She was born on May 4, 1929, in Brussels, Belgium, and her full name was Audrey Kathleen Ruston.

Hepburn began her career in the entertainment industry as a ballet dancer, but later transitioned to acting. She made her film debut in 1951 in the British movie "One Wild Oat" and went on to become one of the most iconic actresses of her time. Some of her most notable films include "Roman Holiday," "Breakfast at Tiffany's," and "My Fair Lady," for which she won an Academy Award for Best Actress.

In addition to her successful career in Hollywood, Hepburn was also known for her humanitarian work. She served as a Goodwill Ambassador for UNICEF and traveled around the world to raise awareness about children's rights and education. Hepburn also received several awards for her work, including the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

Hepburn passed away on January 20, 1993, in Tolochenaz, Switzerland, at the age of 63. She is remembered as a talented actress, a fashion icon, and a dedicated humanitarian.

name: Giovanni Ferrero
bio: Giovanni Ferrero is an Italian billionaire businessman and philanthropist. He is the chairman of Ferrero Group, an Italian multinational confectionery company. He is the 15th richest person in the world with a net worth of $80 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Giovanni Ferrero is an Italian businessman and the CEO of Ferrero SpA, one of the world's largest confectionery companies. Born on September 21, 1964, in Farigliano, Italy, Ferrero joined the family business in 1989 and was appointed CEO in 1997 following the death of his father, Michele Ferrero.

Under Ferrero's leadership, the Ferrero Group has expanded its portfolio beyond its iconic Nutella and Ferrero Rocher brands to include other popular products such as Tic Tac, Kinder, and Nutella B-Ready. The company has also expanded its global presence, with operations in over 50 countries.

Ferrero is known for his hands-on approach to business, often visiting production sites and meeting with employees to better understand the company's operations. He is also a strong advocate for sustainability and has made a commitment to sourcing 100% of the company's cocoa from sustainable sources by 2020.

In addition to his business interests, Ferrero is also involved in philanthropy and is a member of the board of directors of the Ferrero Foundation, which supports various social and cultural initiatives. He has also donated millions of euros to various charities and organizations, including a recent donation to support the COVID-19 response in Italy.

As of 2021, Ferrero has an estimated net worth of over $35 billion, making him one of the richest people in Italy and the world.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
bio: Franklin D. Roosevelt was the 32nd President of the United States, serving from 1933 until his death in 1945. He led the country through its Great Depression and its entry into World War II, and he is widely considered one of the greatest Presidents in U.S. history for his leadership during some of the country's most challenging times. During his presidency, Roosevelt implemented policies known as the New Deal, which aimed to provide relief and recovery from the Great Depression, and he led the country to victory in World War II.
briefBio:
Franklin Delano Roosevelt (FDR) was the 32nd President of the United States, serving from 1933 until his death in 1945. Born in Hyde Park, New York, in 1882, FDR was a member of the Democratic Party and led the country through some of its most significant challenges, including the Great Depression and World War II.

During his presidency, FDR implemented the New Deal, a series of programs and policies aimed at providing economic relief and recovery for the country. The New Deal included initiatives such as the Civilian Conservation Corps, which put unemployed men to work on public lands, and the Social Security Act, which established a system of retirement benefits for workers.

FDR's leadership during World War II was also crucial. He worked with Allied leaders to develop strategies for defeating Nazi Germany and Japan, and he addressed the nation in his famous "fireside chats" to rally support for the war effort.

FDR was elected to four terms as President, but he died in office on April 12, 1945, just months before the end of World War II. He remains one of the most revered and influential presidents in American history.

name: Larry Ellison
origin: New York City, New York, U.S.
bio: Lawrence Joseph Ellison is an American billionaire businessman, philanthropist, and co-founder of Oracle Corporation. He is the fifth-richest person in the world, with an estimated net worth of $100 billion as of February 2023.
briefBio:
Larry Ellison is an American businessman and entrepreneur. He was born on August 17, 1944, in New York City.

Ellison is best known as the co-founder and former CEO of the software giant Oracle Corporation. He played a key role in the development of the company's database software and helped to grow it into one of the largest software companies in the world.

Ellison has also been involved in a number of other business ventures, including founding the cloud computing company NetSuite and investing in Tesla, the electric car company.

Known for his outspoken and often controversial views, Ellison has made headlines for his lavish lifestyle, including owning several multimillion-dollar homes and yachts. He is also known for his philanthropic work, including donations to medical research and education initiatives.

In addition to his business ventures, Ellison is also an accomplished sailor and has competed in a number of high-profile sailing competitions, including the America's Cup.

With his visionary approach to technology and business, Larry Ellison remains a significant figure in the world of tech and innovation.

name: Natalie Portman
bio: Natalie Portman is an Israeli-American actress and filmmaker. She began acting at the age of 12 and gained international recognition for her role as Padmé Amidala in the Star Wars prequel trilogy. Portman has also appeared in numerous other films, including Black Swan, V for Vendetta, and Jackie, for which she received an Academy Award nomination.
